Tenant will have unconditionally accepted the Parcel covered by such Lease Supplement (provided that nothing

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.19</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Capital Adequacy.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;If, after the date hereof, Landlord, Administrative
Agent or any Rent Purchaser shall have reasonably determined that the adoption after the date hereof of any Legal Requirement regarding capital adequacy, or any change therein, or any change in the
interpretation or administration thereof by any Governmental Authority charged with the interpretation or administration thereof, or any request or directive regarding capital adequacy, whether or not
having the force of law, of any such Governmental Authority, has or would have the effect of reducing the rate of return on the capital of Landlord or any Rent Purchaser as a consequence of its
obligations hereunder to a level below that which Landlord or any Rent Purchaser could have achieved but for such adoption, change or compliance (taking into consideration Landlord's and Rent
Purchasers' policies with respect to capital adequacy), then from time to time, within fifteen (15) days after written demand (which demand shall be accompanied by a statement setting forth the basis
for such demand) delivered to Tenant by Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser, Tenant shall pay to Landlord, Administrative Agent and/ or such Rent Purchaser such additional amount or
amounts as will compensate Landlord, Administrative Agent and/or any Rent Purchaser for such reduction.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.20</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Affirmative Covenants of Tenant.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Until the termination of this Lease and
the satisfaction in full by Tenant of all Obligations, Tenant will comply, and will cause compliance, with the following affirmative covenants, unless Landlord and Majority Rent Purchasers shall
otherwise consent in writing:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Statements, Reports, etc.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant shall furnish to Landlord and
Administrative Agent, with sufficient copies for each Rent Purchaser, the following, each in such form and such detail as Landlord, Administrative Agent or Majority Rent Purchasers shall reasonably
request:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;As soon as available and in no event later than forty-five (45) days after the last day of each fiscal quarter of Tenant, a copy of the Financial Statements of
Tenant and its Subsidiaries (prepared on a consolidated basis) for such quarter and for the fiscal year to date, certified by the chief executive officer or chief financial officer of Tenant to
present fairly in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and other information reflected therein and to have been prepared in accordance with GAAP (subject to normal
year-end audit adjustments);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;As soon as available and in no event later than ninety (90) days after the close of each fiscal year of Tenant, (A)&nbsp;copies of the audited Financial
Statements of Tenant and its Subsidiaries (prepared on a consolidated basis) for such year, audited by KPMG LLP or other independent certified public accountants of recognized national standing
acceptable to Landlord and Administrative Agent, and (B)&nbsp;copies of the unqualified opinions (or qualified opinions reasonably acceptable to Landlord and Administrative Agent) and, to the extent
delivered and within ten (10)&nbsp;days after delivery, final management letters delivered by such accountants to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors in connection with all such Financial
Statements;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Contemporaneously with the quarterly and year-end Financial Statements required by the foregoing </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>clauses (i)&nbsp;and
(ii)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a compliance certificate of the chief executive officer, chief financial officer or treasurer of Tenant (a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Compliance
Certificate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") which (A)&nbsp;states that the representations and warranties of Tenant set forth in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>21.18 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and in the other
Operative Documents are true and correct in all material respects as if made on such date (except for representations and warranties expressly made as of a specified date, which shall be true as of
such date) and no Default has occurred and is continuing, or, if any such Default has occurred and is continuing, a statement as to the nature thereof and what action Tenant proposes to take with
respect thereto; (B) sets forth, for the quarter, year or other applicable period covered by such Financial Statements or as of the last day of such quarter or year (as the case may be), the
<!-- SEQ.=2,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=34,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
calculation of the financial ratios and tests provided in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections&nbsp;21.21(f)&nbsp;and 21.22</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; (C)&nbsp;upon Landlord's or Administrative
Agent's request, attaches copies of any letters being provided routinely to requesting vendors or customers at such time describing the Year 2000 remediation efforts of Tenant and its Subsidiaries and
(D)&nbsp;lists all Subsidiaries of Tenant and identifies each such Subsidiary which is a Material Subsidiary;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;As soon as available and in no event later than forty-five (45) days after the last day of each fiscal quarter of Tenant, a certificate of the chief financial
officer or treasurer of Tenant which sets forth the calculation of Tenant's Debt/EBITDA Ratio for the consecutive four-quarter period ending as of such date;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;As soon as possible and in no event later than five (5)&nbsp;Business Days after any officer of Tenant knows of the occurrence or existence of (A)&nbsp;any
Reportable Event under any Employee Benefit Plan or Multiemployer Plan; (B)&nbsp;any actual litigation, suits or claims against Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries which individually asserts a claim
for monetary damages payable by Tenant or its Subsidiaries of $10,000,000 or more; (C)&nbsp;any other event or condition which is reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect; or
(D)&nbsp;any Default; the statement of the chief executive officer, chief financial officer or treasurer of Tenant setting forth details of such event, condition or Default and the action which
Tenant proposes to take with respect thereto;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;As soon as available and in no event later than five (5)&nbsp;Business Days after they are sent, made available or filed, copies of (A)&nbsp;all registration
statements and reports filed by Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries with any securities exchange or the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (including, without limitation, all 10-Q, 10-K
and 8-K reports); (B)&nbsp;all reports, proxy statements and financial statements sent or made available by Tenant to its security holders; and (C)&nbsp;all press releases concerning any material
developments in the business of Tenant made available by Tenant to the public generally; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;Such other instruments, agreements, certificates, opinions, statements, documents and information relating to the operations or condition (financial or otherwise)
of Tenant or its Subsidiaries, and compliance by Tenant with the terms of this Lease and the other Credit Documents as Landlord and Administrative Agent may from time to time reasonably request.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Books and Records.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries shall at all times keep
proper books of record and account in which full, true and correct entries will be made of their transactions in accordance with GAAP.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Inspections.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries shall permit Landlord,
Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser, or any agent or representative thereof, upon reasonable notice and during normal business hours and to the extent reasonably necessary for the
administration of the Obligations, to visit and
inspect any of the properties and offices of Tenant and its Material Subsidiaries, to examine the books and records of Tenant and its Subsidiaries and make copies thereof, and to discuss the affairs,
finances and business of Tenant and its Subsidiaries with, and to be advised as to the same by, their officers and, after prior written notice to Tenant, their auditors and accountants, all at such
times and intervals as Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser may reasonably request; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, (i)&nbsp;unless an Event of
Default shall have occurred and be continuing, any such visit and inspection shall be made at the sole expense of Landlord or Administrative Agent whose agent or representative is making such visit
and inspection and (ii)&nbsp;when an Event of Default exists, any such visit and inspection shall be made at the sole expense of Tenant.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(d)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Insurance.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Without limiting Article&nbsp;IX, Tenant and its Material
Subsidiaries shall:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Carry and maintain insurance of the types and in the amounts customarily carried from time to time during the term of this Lease by others engaged in substantially
the same business as
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=35,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
such Entity and operating in the same geographic area as such Entity, including, but not limited to, fire, public liability, property damage and worker's compensation;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Carry and maintain each policy for such insurance with (A)&nbsp;a company which is rated A or better by&nbsp;A.M. Best and Company at the time such policy is
placed and at the time of each such annual renewal thereof or (B)&nbsp;any other insurer which is reasonably satisfactory to Landlord and Administrative Agent; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Deliver to Landlord and Administrative Agent upon request not more than once each year schedules setting forth all insurance then in effect.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(e)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Charges and Other Indebtedness.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries
shall promptly pay and discharge when due (i)&nbsp;all taxes and other Governmental Charges prior to the date upon which penalties accrue thereon, (ii) all indebtedness which, if unpaid, could
become a Lien upon the property of Tenant or its Material Subsidiaries and (iii)&nbsp;subject to any subordination provisions applicable thereto, all other Indebtedness which in each case, if
unpaid, is reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect, except such Indebtedness as may in good faith be contested or disputed, or for which arrangements for deferred payment have been made,
provided that in each such case appropriate reserves are maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of Landlord and Administrative Agent.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(f)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;General Business Operations.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Other than as permitted by</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections&nbsp;21.21(c) and 21.21(d) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>each of Tenant and its Subsidiaries shall (i)&nbsp;preserve and maintain its corporate existence and all of its
rights, privileges and franchises reasonably necessary to the conduct of its business, (ii)&nbsp;conduct its business activities in compliance with all Legal Requirements and Contractual Obligations
applicable to such Entity and (iii)&nbsp;keep all property useful and necessary in its business in good working order and condition, ordinary wear and tear excepted, except, in each case, where any
failure is not reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect. Tenant shall maintain its chief executive office and principal place of business in the United States.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(g)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Year 2000 Compatibility.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries shall take all acts
reasonably necessary to ensure that all software, hardware, firmware, equipment, goods and systems utilized by or material to their business operations or financial condition will properly perform
date sensitive functions before, during and after the year 2000 except where the failure to do so would not have a Material Adverse Effect.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.21</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Negative Covenants of Tenant.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Until the termination of this Lease and the
satisfaction in full by Tenant of all Obligations, Tenant will comply, and will cause compliance, with the following negative covenants, unless Landlord and Majority Rent Purchasers shall otherwise
consent in writing:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Indebtedness.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall create,
incur, assume or permit to exist any Indebtedness except for the following:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;The Obligations of Tenant under the Operative Documents;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries (A)&nbsp;arising under the Credit Agreement, dated as of the Date of Lease, among Tenant, as borrower, the Rent
Purchasers and certain other financial institutions, as lenders, and Administrative Agent or (B)&nbsp;listed in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit F</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> and existing on the Date of
Lease which is not otherwise permitted under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section 21.21(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries arising from the endorsement of instruments for collection in the ordinary course of their businesses;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for trade accounts payable, provided that (A)&nbsp;such accounts arise in the ordinary course of business and
(B)&nbsp;no material part of any such
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=36,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
account is more than ninety (90) days past due (unless subject to a bona fide dispute and for which adequate reserves have been established);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries under Rate Contracts, provided that, at the time each Rate Contract is entered into, such Rate Contract is for bona fide
hedging operations and not for speculation;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries under initial or successive refinancings of any Indebtedness permitted by</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>clause&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>above, provided that (A)&nbsp;the principal amount of any such refinancing does not exceed the principal amount of
the Indebtedness being refinanced and (B)&nbsp;the material terms and provisions of any such refinancing (including maturity, redemption, prepayment, default and subordination provisions) are no
less favorable to Landlord or the Rent Purchasers than the Indebtedness being refinanced;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries with respect to surety, appeal, indemnity, performance or other similar bonds in the ordinary course of business
(including surety or similar bonds issued in connection with the stay of a proceeding of the type described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section 19.1(h)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)&nbsp;Guaranty Obligations of Tenant in respect of Indebtedness of its Subsidiaries permitted by this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section 21.21(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ix)&nbsp;Indebtedness of Tenant to any of its Subsidiaries, Indebtedness of any of Tenant's Subsidiaries to Tenant or Indebtedness of any of Tenant's Subsidiaries to any of
Tenant's other Subsidiaries;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(x)&nbsp;Other Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries, provided that the aggregate principal amount of all such other Indebtedness outstanding at any time does not
exceed the sum of $200,000,000 plus ten percent (10%) of Tenant's Net Worth determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding fiscal quarter.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Liens.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall create, incur,
assume or permit to exist any Lien on or with respect to any of its assets or property of any character, whether now owned or hereafter acquired, except for the following
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Permitted Liens</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"):</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Liens in favor of Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser securing the Obligations;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Liens listed on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule 2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>to any Lease Supplement as approved by Landlord and Administrative Agent or listed on</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit G </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and existing on the Date of Lease;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Liens for taxes or other Governmental Charges not at the time delinquent or thereafter payable without penalty or being contested in good faith, provided that
adequate reserves for the payment thereof have been established in accordance with GAAP;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Liens of carriers, warehousemen, mechanics, materialmen, vendors, and landlords and other similar Liens imposed by law incurred in the ordinary course of business
for sums not overdue more than 45 days or being contested in good faith, provided that adequate reserves for the payment thereof have been established in accordance with GAAP;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Deposits under workers' compensation, unemployment insurance and social security laws or to secure the performance of bids, tenders, contracts (other than for the
repayment of borrowed money) or leases, or to secure statutory obligations of surety or appeal bonds or to secure indemnity, performance or other similar bonds in the ordinary course of business;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;Zoning restrictions, easements, rights-of-way, title irregularities and other similar encumbrances, which alone or in the aggregate are not substantial in amount
and do not
<!-- SEQ.=5,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=37,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
materially detract from the value of the property subject thereto or interfere with the ordinary conduct of the business of Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;Banker's Liens and similar Liens (including set-off rights) in respect of bank deposits;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)&nbsp;Liens on any property or assets acquired, or on the property or assets of any Entities acquired, by Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries after the Date of Lease
pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(d)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, provided that (A)&nbsp;such Liens exist at the time such property or assets or such Entities are so acquired and
(B) such Liens were not created in contemplation of such acquisitions;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ix)&nbsp;Judgment Liens, provided that such Liens do not constitute an Event of Default under </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;19.1(h);</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(x)&nbsp;Liens in favor of customs and revenue authorities arising as a matter of law to secure payment of customs duties and in connection with the importation of goods in
the ordinary course of Tenant's and its Subsidiaries' businesses;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xi)&nbsp;Liens securing purchase money loans and Capital Leases incurred by Tenant and its Subsidiaries to finance their acquisition of real property, fixtures or equipment
provided that (A)&nbsp;in each case, the Indebtedness secured by such Liens (1)&nbsp;is incurred by such Entity at the time of, or not later than ninety (90) days after, the acquisition by such
Entity of the property so financed, (2)&nbsp;does not exceed the purchase price of the property so financed; and (3)&nbsp;constitutes Indebtedness permitted under</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; and (B)&nbsp;in each case, such Lien (1)&nbsp;covers only those assets, the acquisition of which was financed by such
Indebtedness permitted under </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, and (2)&nbsp;secures only such Permitted Indebtedness; and provided, further, that this</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>clause (xi) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall apply to Liens incurred to finance the
costs incurred by Adobe Systems Europe, Ltd. to acquire real property in Scotland prior to the Date of Lease, construct improvements thereon and install fixtures and equipment therein prior to
completion so long as the Indebtedness secured thereby meets all of the foregoing requirements except </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>clause (A)(1);</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xii)&nbsp;Liens on the property or assets of any Subsidiary of Tenant in favor of Tenant or any other Subsidiary of Tenant;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xiii)&nbsp;Liens incurred in connection with the extension, renewal or refinancing of the Indebtedness secured by the Liens described in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>clause&nbsp;(xi)&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>above, provided that any extension, renewal or replacement Lien (A)&nbsp;is limited to the property covered by the
existing Lien and (B)&nbsp;secures Indebtedness which is no greater in amount and has material terms no less favorable to Landlord or the Rent Purchasers than the Indebtedness secured by the
existing Lien; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xiv)&nbsp;Other Liens, provided that the aggregate principal amount of such Indebtedness outstanding at any time does not exceed ten percent (10%) of Tenant's Net Worth
determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding fiscal quarter.</FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Notwithstanding the foregoing, with respect to the Parcels only the Liens described in clauses (i)&nbsp;through (iv)&nbsp;shall be considered "Permitted Liens."</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Asset Dispositions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall sell,
lease, transfer or otherwise dispose of any of its assets or property, whether now owned or hereafter acquired, except for the following:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Sales by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of inventory in the ordinary course of their businesses;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Sales by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of surplus, damaged, worn or obsolete equipment or inventory in the ordinary course of their businesses;
<!-- SEQ.=6,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=38,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Sales by Tenant and its Subsidiaries or other dispositions of Investments permitted by </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(e);</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Sales or assignments by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of defaulted receivables to a collection agency in the ordinary course of their businesses;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Licenses by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of their products, patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade names, trade secrets, service marks and any other intellectual
property in the ordinary course of their businesses;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;Sales by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of closed facilities which are for cash and do not exceed $55,000,000 in the aggregate during the Term;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;Sales, licenses or other dispositions of assets and property by Tenant to any of Tenant's Subsidiaries or by any of Tenant's Subsidiaries to Tenant or any of its
other Subsidiaries; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)&nbsp;Other sales, leases, transfers and disposals by Tenant and its Subsidiaries of assets and property, provided that(A)&nbsp;no Default has occurred and is
continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such sale, lease, transfer or disposal and (B)&nbsp;the aggregate book value of all such assets and property so sold, leased,
transferred or otherwise disposed of in any fiscal year does not exceed ten
percent (10%) of Tenant's Net Worth determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding fiscal year.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(d)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Mergers, Acquisitions, Etc.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries
shall consolidate with or merge into any other Entity or permit any other Entity to merge into it, establish any new Subsidiary, acquire any Entity as a new Subsidiary or acquire all or substantially
all of the assets of any other Entity, except as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries may merge with each other, provided that (A)&nbsp;no Default has occurred and is continuing on the date of, or will result after
giving effect to, any such merger and (B)&nbsp;in any such merger involving Tenant, Tenant is the surviving corporation;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Any Subsidiary of Tenant may dissolve after transferring or distributing its assets to Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries, provided that no Default has occurred and
is continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such dissolution; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Tenant and its Subsidiaries may establish any new Subsidiary or acquire any Entity as a new Subsidiary or all or substantially all of the assets of any other
Entity, provided that no Default has occurred and is continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such acquisition.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(e)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall make any
Investment except for Investments in the following:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Investments permitted by the investment policy of Tenant set forth in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit D </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>or, if any changes to the investment
policy of Tenant are hereafter duly approved by the Board of Directors of Tenant or designated committee thereof, in any subsequent investment policy which is the most recent investment policy
delivered by Tenant to Landlord and Administrative Agent with a certificate of Tenant's chief financial officer to the effect that such investment policy has been duly approved by Tenant's Board of
Directors and is then in effect;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Investments listed in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit D </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>existing on the Date of Lease which are not otherwise permitted by the investment
policy of Tenant set forth in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit D;</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Investments received by Tenant and its Subsidiaries in connection with the bankruptcy or reorganization of customers and suppliers and in settlement of delinquent
obligations of, and other disputes with, customers and suppliers arising in the ordinary course of business;
<!-- SEQ.=7,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=39,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Investments arising from rights received by Tenant and its Subsidiaries upon the required payment of any permitted Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Investments consisting of loans to employees, officers and directors of Tenant or its Subsidiaries;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vi)&nbsp;Investments by Tenant and its Subsidiaries in Rate Contracts, provided that, at the time each Rate Contract is entered into, such Rate Contract is for bona fide
hedging operations and not for speculation;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(vii)&nbsp;Deposit accounts;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(viii)&nbsp;Investments permitted by </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(d)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ix)&nbsp;Investments by Tenant and its Subsidiaries in each other;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(x)&nbsp;Venture capital Investments made by Tenant and/or its Subsidiaries and Adobe Ventures, L.P., Adobe Ventures II, L.P. and any other venture capital partnership in
which all of the limited partners are Tenant, its Subsidiaries, its Affiliates or employees of Tenant or its Subsidiaries (individually, a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>VC
Partnership</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), provided that (A)&nbsp;at the time a venture capital Investment is made in any Entity, such Entity either operates or is expected to operate in an industry
related to the business operations of Tenant or its Subsidiaries (including Entities which possess or may possess technologies, sales and services capabilities, operations or content related to any
product of Tenant or its Subsidiaries) or has been identified by Tenant as a candidate for a strategic relationship with Tenant or its Subsidiaries, (B)&nbsp;the aggregate consideration paid
(including Indebtedness incurred) by Tenant or its Subsidiaries for all such venture capital Investments (less any return of capital received in cash on the sale of such venture capital Investments
and any gain or other income realized on such venture capital Investments which is reinvested in new venture capital Investments) does not exceed $175,000,000 at any time, and (C)&nbsp;no Default
has occurred and is continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such venture capital Investment;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xi)&nbsp;Investments consisting of purchase money financing provided by Tenant and its Subsidiaries to their customers; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(xii)&nbsp;Other Investments, provided that:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;No Default has occurred and is continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such Investment; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;The aggregate consideration paid (including Indebtedness incurred) by Tenant and its Subsidiaries for all such Investments in any fiscal year does not exceed ten
percent (10%) of Tenant's Net Worth determined as of the last day of the immediately preceding fiscal year.</FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(f)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividends, Redemptions, Etc.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries
shall pay any dividends or make any distributions on its Equity Securities; purchase, redeem, retire, defease or otherwise acquire for value any of its Equity Securities; return any capital to any
holder of its Equity Securities as such; make any distribution of assets, Equity Securities, obligations or securities to any holder of its Equity Securities as such; or set apart any sum for any such
purpose; except as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries may pay dividends on its capital stock payable solely in such Entity's own capital stock and Tenant may purchase, redeem, retire,
defease or otherwise acquire for value capital stock of Tenant issued to employees of Tenant or its Subsidiaries in exchange for other capital stock of Tenant;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Any Subsidiary of Tenant may pay dividends to or repurchase its capital stock from Tenant;
<!-- SEQ.=8,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=40,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Adobe Incentive Partners may make Adobe Incentive Partners Distributions and any VC Partnership may make distributions to its partners;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Tenant may repurchase its capital stock from an employee of Tenant or its Subsidiaries (A)&nbsp;in an amount equal to any taxes payable by such employee upon the
exercise of options to purchase capital stock of Tenant, or (B)&nbsp;upon termination of such employee's employment; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Tenant may pay other dividends on its capital stock in cash or repurchase its capital stock for cash, provided that:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;In each case, no Event of Default has occurred and is continuing on the date of, or will result after giving effect to, any such payment or repurchase; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;If the Debt/EBITDA Ratio of Tenant for any consecutive four-quarter period is equal to or greater than 1.25:1.00, the sum of Tenant's Net Share Repurchases and cash
dividends (excluding dividends payable pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>clauses (ii) and (iii) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>above) for the next succeeding quarter shall not exceed forty percent (40%) of
Tenant's EBITDA for such consecutive four-quarter period.</FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(g)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Change in Business.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall engage
in any business substantially different from its present business, as described in the 10-K report filed by Tenant with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the fiscal year ended
November&nbsp;27, 1998, and other internet-related services for its customers.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(h)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee Benefit Plans.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any ERISA Affiliate shall (A)&nbsp;adopt or institute any Employee Benefit Plan that is an employee pension benefit plan within the meaning of
Section&nbsp;3(2)&nbsp;of ERISA, (B)&nbsp;take any action which will result in the partial or complete withdrawal, within the meanings of section&nbsp;s 4203 and 4205 of ERISA, from a
Multiemployer Plan, (C)&nbsp;engage or permit any Entity to engage in any transaction prohibited by section&nbsp;406 of ERISA or section&nbsp;4975 of the IRC involving any Employee Benefit Plan
or Multiemployer Plan which would subject Tenant or any ERISA Affiliate to any tax, penalty or other liability including a liability to indemnify, (D)&nbsp;incur or allow to exist any accumulated
funding deficiency (within the meaning of section&nbsp;412 of the IRC or section&nbsp;302 of ERISA), (E)&nbsp;fail to make full payment when due of all amounts due as contributions to any
Employee Benefit Plan or Multiemployer Plan, (F)&nbsp;fail to comply with the requirements of section&nbsp;4980B of the IRC or Part 6 of Title I(B)&nbsp;of ERISA, or (G)&nbsp;adopt any
amendment to any Employee Benefit Plan which would require the posting of security pursuant to section&nbsp;401(a)(29) of the IRC, where singly or cumulatively, the above would be reasonably likely
to have a Material Adverse Effect.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall (A)&nbsp;engage in any transaction prohibited by any Governmental Rule&nbsp;applicable to any Foreign Plan,
(B)&nbsp;fail to make full payment when due of all amounts due as contributions to any Foreign Plan or (C)&nbsp;otherwise fail to comply with the requirements of any Governmental
Rule&nbsp;applicable to any Foreign Plan, where singly or cumulatively, the above would be reasonably likely to have a Material Adverse Effect.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(i)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Transactions With Affiliates.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries
shall enter into any Contractual Obligation with any Affiliate (other than Tenant or one of its Subsidiaries) or engage in any other transaction with any Affiliate except (i)&nbsp;for agreements
with officers and directors of Tenant or its Subsidiaries for indemnification or participation under Tenant's equity plans and loans to or retention or severance agreements with officers and directors
of Tenant or its Subsidiaries, each as approved by the Board of Directors of Tenant; (ii)&nbsp;upon terms at least as favorable to Tenant or such Subsidiary as an arms-length transaction with
unaffiliated Entities; or (iii)&nbsp;for transactions with
<!-- SEQ.=9,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=41,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
Affiliates in which Tenant or its Subsidiaries have venture capital Investments permitted by </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21(e)(x).</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(j)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Accounting Changes.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Neither Tenant nor any of its Subsidiaries shall change
(i)&nbsp;its fiscal year (currently ending the Friday closest to November&nbsp;30) or (ii)&nbsp;its accounting practices except as required by GAAP.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.22</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Covenants.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Until the termination of this Lease and the
satisfaction in full by Tenant of all Obligations, Tenant will comply, and will cause compliance, with the following financial covenants, unless Landlord and Majority Rent Purchasers shall otherwise
consent in writing:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(a)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Quick Ratio.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord shall not permit its Quick Rate to be less than 1.00
on the last day of any fiscal quarter.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(b)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Debt/EBITDA Ratio.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant shall not permit its Debt/EBITDA Ratio for any
consecutive four-quarter to be greater than 2.50.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>(c)</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant shall not permit its Fixed Charge
Coverage Ratio for any consecutive four-quarter period to be less than 2.25.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.23</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Regulation D Compensation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;For so long as the Landlord or any Rent
Purchaser is required to maintain reserves against Eurocurrency Liabilities (or any other category of liabilities which include deposits by reference to which the LIBOR Rate is determined or any
category of extensions of credit or other assets which includes loans by a non-United States office of the Landlord or any Rent Purchaser to United States residents), and, as a result, the cost to the
Landlord or such Rent Purchaser (or its funding office) of making or maintaining its Advances is increased, then the Landlord or such Rent Purchaser may require the Tenant to pay, contemporaneously
with each payment of Base Rent, an additional amount (the "Additional Amount") at a rate per annum up to but not exceeding the excess of (i)&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;the applicable LIBOR Rate divided by
(B)&nbsp;one </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>minus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>the Eurocurrency Reserve Requirements, over (ii)&nbsp;the applicable LIBOR Rate. In the event that the Landlord or such Rent
Purchaser wishes to require payment of the Additional Amount, Landlord or such Rent Purchaser (through Administrative Agent), (x) shall so notify the Tenant, in which case the Additional Amount shall
be payable to the Landlord or such Rent Purchaser, at the place indicated in such notice with respect to each Borrowing Period commencing at least three (3)&nbsp;Business Days after the giving of
such notice and (y) shall furnish to the Tenant at least five (5)&nbsp;business days prior to each date on which Base Rent is payable (the "Additional Amount Notice") a certificate setting forth the
Additional Amount to which it is then entitled under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.21 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(which shall be consistent with its good faith estimate of the level at
which the related reserves are maintained by it). Each such certificate shall be accompanied by such information as the Tenant may reasonably request as to the computation set forth therein.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.24</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Nonmerger of Estates.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;If both Landlord's and Tenant's estates in the
Parcels become vested in the same owner, this Lease shall nevertheless not be destroyed by application of the doctrine of merger except at the express election of Landlord and the consent of
Administrative Agent.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.25</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Title to and Nature of Improvements.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the provisions of</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Sections&nbsp;12.2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and as otherwise appropriate in this Lease, Tenant agrees that any and all Improvements of whatever nature at any time constructed,
placed or maintained upon any part of the Land shall be and remain the property of the Landlord, subject to Tenant's rights under this Lease, including, without limitation,</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>and the rights of Administrative Agent and the Rent Purchasers under the Operative Documents.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.26</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Nondiscrimination.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant hereby covenants by and for itself, its heirs,
executors, administrators and assigns, and all persons claiming under or through it, and this Lease is made and accepted upon and subject to the following conditions: that there shall be no
discrimination against or segregation of any person or group of persons on account of race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, handicap, marital status, ancestry or national origin in the leasing,
subleasing, transferring, use, occupancy, tenure or enjoyment of
<!-- SEQ.=10,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=42,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
the Parcels herein leased, nor shall Tenant itself, or any person claiming under or through it establish
or permit any such practice or practices of discrimination or segregation with reference to the selection, location, number, use or occupancy of tenants, lessees, subtenants, sublessees or vendees in
the Parcels herein leased.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.27</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Grant of Option by Landlord to SPC.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the
contrary herein, Landlord may grant to a special purpose funding entity which is an Affiliate of such Landlord (such entity being an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>SPC</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the option
to provide to Tenant all or part of any Commitment Amount that Landlord would otherwise be obligated to advance to Tenant, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that
(i)&nbsp;nothing herein shall constitute a commitment to make any loan by any SPC, (ii)&nbsp;if an SPC elects not to exercise such option or otherwise fails to provide all or any part of such
commitment, Landlord shall be obligated to make such advance pursuant to the terms hereof, and (iii)&nbsp;Landlord shall not sell or transfer to such SPC Landlord's interest in any Parcel. The
making of an advance by an SPC hereunder shall utilize the commitment of the Landlord to the same extent, and as if, such advance were made by Landlord, but shall not release Landlord from any other
liability under the Operative Documents. Each party hereto agrees that no SPC shall be liable for any indemnity or similar payment obligation under this Lease or the other Operative Documents (all
liability for which shall remain with Landlord). In furtherance of the foregoing, each party hereto hereby agrees, which agreement shall survive the termination of this Lease, that, prior to the date
that is one year and one day after the payment in full all outstanding senior Indebtedness of any SPC, it will not institute against, or join any other Entity in instituting against, such SPC any
bankruptcy, reorganization, arrangement, insolvency or liquidation proceedings or similar proceedings under the laws of the United States of America or any state thereof. In addition, notwithstanding
anything to the contrary contained in this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.27</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, any SPC may with notice, but without prior written consent of Tenant and without paying
any registration and proceeding fee, assign all or part of its interest in any amounts advanced hereunder by Landlord. In no event shall Tenant be obligated to pay to an SPC that has made a advance
hereunder any greater amount than Tenant would have been obligated to pay under this Lease if Landlord had made such Advance the Tenant and Administrative Agent shall continue to deal solely and
directly with, and send notices solely to, Landlord with respect to any amounts advanced hereunder by its SPC and Landlord shall not transfer or grant to its SPC the right to approve any amendment,
waiver or consent hereunder. This </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.27 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>may not be amended without the written consent of Landlord.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE XXII<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INDEMNIFICATION</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax Indemnity.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Article&nbsp;8 (Taxes)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> to the contrary, Tenant shall protect and defend Landlord, Administrative Agent and Rent Purchasers from and against all
criminal prosecution regarding and shall indemnify and hold Landlord, Administrative Agent and Rent Purchasers harmless from and against any and all losses, costs, liabilities or damages (including
reasonable attorneys' fees and disbursements and court costs) arising by reason of:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Any and all U.S. Federal, state or local income taxes imposed upon Landlord, Administrative Agent or Rent Purchasers in consequence of Landlord, Administrative
Agent or Rent Purchasers being treated as the owner or lessor of the Parcels (or any part thereof) for such tax purposes to the extent such taxes exceed such entity's tax liability under this
transaction if such entity were not treated as the owner or lessor of the Parcels (but as lender) for tax purposes; provided Landlord has fully complied with</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;21.2;</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Any and all taxes imposed upon Tenant (except to the extent of Landlord's Taxes or to the extent that such taxes are imposed upon Tenant as a result of Landlord's
failure to comply with its obligations under this Lease);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Any and all taxes required to be withheld from payments made by Tenant to a third party not related to or affiliated with Landlord;
<!-- SEQ.=11,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=43,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Any and all Real Estate Taxes;</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Any and all taxes owed by Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser (other than Landlord Taxes) as a result of payment made by Tenant to such entity
pursuant to Tenant's indemnity obligations under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;22.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;Any and all costs, liabilities or damages (including reasonable attorneys' fees) incurred by Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser in obtaining
indemnification payments from Tenant under the provisions of this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;22.1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant's duty to indemnify Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;22.1 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall apply only to
taxes arising during the Term (whether or not due and payable at the conclusion of the Term), but shall otherwise survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Indemnification Concerning the Parcels.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant will defend, protect,
indemnify and save harmless Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser from and against all liabilities, obligations, claims, damages, causes of action, costs and expenses, imposed upon or
incurred by Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser by reason of the occurrence or existence of any of the following during the Term, except to the extent caused by the willful
misconduct, gross negligence, or willful breach of contract of such Entity or its respective agents: (a)&nbsp;any accident, injury to or death of persons or loss of or damage to property occurring
on or about the Parcels or Improvements; (b)&nbsp;performance of any labor or services or the furnishing of any materials or other property in respect of the Parcels or the Improvements;
(d)&nbsp;the negligence or willful misconduct on the part of Tenant or any of its agents, invitees, employees or contractors or any other persons entering onto the Parcels or the Improvements at the
request, behest or with the permission of Tenant; (d)&nbsp;the use or occupancy of the Improvements; or (e)&nbsp;the use of the Land. Tenant's duty to indemnify Landlord, Administrative Agent and
each Rent Purchaser under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;22.2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease with respect to events occurring
during the Term or after the Term while Landlord has record title to and Tenant is occupying the Parcels.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.3</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Environmental Indemnity.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant agrees to indemnify and hold Landlord,
Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser harmless from and against, and to reimburse Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser with respect to, any and all claims, demands, causes of
action, losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses (including attorneys' fees and court costs), fines and/or penalties of any and every kind or character, known or unknown, fixed or contingent,
asserted or potentially asserted against or incurred by Landlord, Administrative Agent or such Rent Purchaser at any time and from time to time by reason of, in connection with or arising out of
(a)&nbsp;the failure of Tenant to perform any obligation herein required to be performed by Tenant regarding Applicable Environmental Laws, (b)&nbsp;any violation of any Applicable Environmental
Law by Tenant with respect to the Parcels or any disposal or other release by Tenant or with respect to the Parcels of any hazardous substance, environmental contaminants or solid waste on or to the
Parcels, whether or not resulting in a violation of any Applicable Environmental Law, (c)&nbsp;any act, omission, event or circumstance by Tenant or with any respect to the Parcels which constitutes
or has constituted violation of any Applicable Environmental Law with respect to the Parcels, regardless of whether the act, omission, event or circumstance constituted a violation of any Applicable
Environmental Law at the time of its existence or occurrence, and (d)&nbsp;any and all claims or proceedings (whether brought by private party or governmental agencies) for bodily injury, property
damage, abatement or remediation, environmental damage or impairment or any
other injury or damage resulting from or relating to any hazardous or toxic substance or contaminated material located upon or migrating into, from or through the Parcels (whether or not the release
of such materials was caused by Tenant, a subtenant, a prior owner of the Parcels or any other Entity) which Landlord, Administrative Agent or such Rent Purchaser may incur. Tenant's duty to indemnify
Landlord, Administrative Agent or such Rent Purchaser under this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;22.3 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of the Lease or
applicable Lease Supplement with respect to events occurring during or prior to the Term or after the Term while Landlord has record title to and Tenant is occupying the Parcels.
<!-- SEQ.=12,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=44,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.4</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;General Indemnity.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except to the extent of the gross negligence or willful
misconduct of the Entity seeking such indemnification, Tenant shall defend, indemnify, and hold Landlord, Administrative Agent and each Rent Purchaser harmless from and against any and all losses,
costs, expenses, liabilities, claims, causes of action and damages of all kinds that may result to Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser, including reasonable attorneys' fees and
disbursements incurred by Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser, in any way relating to or arising out of this Lease or the other Operative Documents executed by Tenant in connection
with this Lease or the transactions contemplated hereby or thereby or the enforcement against Tenant of any of the terms hereof or thereof. Tenant's duty to indemnify Landlord, Administrative Agent
and each Rent Purchaser under this Lease shall survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Lease.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ARTICLE XXIII<BR></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>COVENANTS OF LANDLORD</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23.1</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Title.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event Tenant so requests in writing (and so long as either
Tenant agrees to indemnify Landlord to Landlord's satisfaction from any liabilities or obligations in connection therewith, or Landlord does not incur any liabilities or obligations in connection
therewith), Landlord shall execute all documents, instruments and agreements reasonably requested by Tenant in order to accomplish any of the following in the manner reasonably requested by Tenant and
within the time parameters reasonably requested by Tenant: (1) remove exceptions to title to or affecting the Parcels; (2)&nbsp;create exceptions to title (including, without limitation, easements
and rights of way) to or affecting the Parcels; or (3)&nbsp;modify any then-existing exception to title. Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for, or at Landlord's request, pay directly in
advance, all reasonable costs, expenses and other amounts incurred or required to be expended by Landlord in order to comply with Tenant's requests made in accordance with the preceding sentence, and
the failure of Tenant to reimburse or pay any such amounts shall result in the suspension of Landlord's obligations under such sentence with respect to that particular request until the amounts
required to be paid by Tenant under this sentence have been paid.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23.2</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Land Use.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except where requested by Tenant pursuant to this</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;23.2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Landlord shall not cause or give its written consent to any land use or zoning change affecting the Parcels or any changes of
street grade. In the event Tenant so requests in writing (and so long as either Tenant agrees to indemnify Landlord to Landlord's satisfaction, from any liabilities or obligations in connection
therewith, or Landlord does not incur any liabilities or obligations in connection therewith), Landlord shall execute all documents, instruments and agreements reasonably requested by Tenant in order
to accomplish any of the following in the manner reasonably requested by Tenant and within the time parameters reasonably requested by Tenant: (1)&nbsp;cause a change in any land use restriction or
law affecting the Parcels; (2)&nbsp;cause a change in the zoning affecting a Parcels; or (3)&nbsp;cause a change in the street grade with respect to any street in the vicinity of a Parcels. Tenant
shall promptly reimburse Landlord for, or at Landlord's request, pay directly in advance, all reasonable costs, expenses and other amounts incurred or required to be expended by Landlord in order to
comply with Tenant's requests made in
accordance with the preceding sentence, and the failure of Tenant to reimburse or pay any such amounts shall result in the suspension of Landlord's obligations under such sentence with respect to that
particular request until the amounts required to be paid by Tenant under this sentence have been paid. In any event, all land usage shall remain subject to the terms of the Ground Lease, if applicable
to a particular Lease Supplement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23.3</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Transfer of Property Interests.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as requested by Tenant pursuant to
this Lease, Landlord shall not transfer to any third party any rights inuring to or benefits associated with the Parcels (including, without limitation, zoning rights, development rights, air space
rights, mineral, oil, gas or water rights). Nothing in this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;23.3 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>shall limit Landlord's right to transfer Landlord's interest in this
Lease to a third party or its rights to transfer the Parcels, pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;14.2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; provided that as to a transfer under</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;14.2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>any purchaser of Landlord's interest in the Parcels shall be bound by the terms of this Lease, including without limitation the
terms of this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;23.3</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>).
<!-- SEQ.=13,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=45,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KD2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:57' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23.4</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;No Impairment of Value.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;No action shall be taken under</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;23.1, 23.2 or 23.3 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>which would impair the value, utility or useful life of the Improvements without the prior written consent of
Administrative Agent and the Rent Purchasers as provided in the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;23.5</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Ground Leases.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord shall not exercise any of its purchase option
rights under any Ground Lease affecting any Lease Supplement without Tenant's prior written consent, in Tenant's sole discretion.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, the parties hereto have duly executed this Lease as of the day and year first above written.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXHIBIT A<BR></I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO. 1</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;1 is dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999 and executed by and between SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC., a Delaware corporation
("Landlord"), and ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, a Delaware corporation ("Tenant").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord and Tenant have heretofore entered into that certain Amended, Restated and Consolidated Master Lease of Land and Improvements dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, relating to
the lease of certain parcels of real property (herein called the "Lease" and the defined terms therein being hereinafter used with the same meanings). The Lease provides for the execution and delivery
from time to time of Lease Supplements for the purpose of leasing individual Parcels under the Lease as and when delivered by Landlord in accordance with the terms thereof.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Land and Improvements represented by this Lease Supplement were originally leased by Landlord to Tenant by a lease dated October&nbsp;12, 1994, and the terms of such lease are
amended and restated in their entirety by the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and other good and valuable consideration, Landlord and Tenant hereby agree as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Landlord hereby delivers and leases to Tenant under the Lease and Tenant accepts and leases from Landlord under the Lease the Parcel described in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Permitted Title Exceptions are described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The original Lease Investment Balance for this Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1 is $66,702,127.66 and the Guaranteed Residual Value for this Lease Supplement
No.&nbsp;1 is $62,070,230.23.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;The Lease Supplement Term commenced as of the date hereof (the "Rent Commencement Date") and will expire on August&nbsp;11, 2004 (the "Expiration Date").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Tenant hereby confirms its agreement to pay Landlord Base Rent and Additional Rent for the Parcel during the Lease Supplement Term in accordance with</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Article&nbsp;VII </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant hereby confirms to Landlord that Tenant has accepted the Parcel and agrees that it shall be incorporated into the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;The Land upon which the Improvements have been constructed and which is a part of this Lease Supplement is subject to that certain Ground Lease between Landlord, as
ground lessee, and the Redevelopment Agency of the City of San Jose, as ground lessor, dated October&nbsp;12, 1994, a memorandum of which has been recorded with the Santa Clara County Recorder as
Document No.&nbsp;12684585.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;This Lease Supplement may be executed by the parties hereto in separate counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be an original, but all
such counterparts shall together constitute but one and the same instrument.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;This Lease Supplement is being delivered in the State of California and in all respects shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the
State of California, including all matters of construction, validity and performance.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
[Signatures begin on next page.]</FONT></P>

</FONT></P>
</UL>

<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KE2301A.;31',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>Schedule 1 to</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Lease Supplement No. 1</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

DESCRIPTION OF PARCELS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Real property in the City of San Jose, County of Santa Clara, State of California, described as follows:

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>PARCEL ONE:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

Commencing at the point of intersection of the centerline of Park Avenue (60&nbsp;feet wide) with the centerline of the now vacated Locust Street (80&nbsp;feet wide) as said point is shown on that
certain Map entitled "Record of Survey of Properties Bounded by San Carlos Street, San Fernando Street and Guadalupe River, Market-Almaden Streets", which Map filed for record September&nbsp;27,
1966 in Book&nbsp;214 of Maps page&nbsp;54, Santa Clara County Records; thence from said point of commencement along the said centerline of Locust Street, North 29&deg; 50&#39;
44&#34; West 79.00&nbsp;feet to the True Point of Beginning of this description; thence South 58&deg; 14&#39; 29&#34; West 153.83&nbsp;feet; thence South
59&deg; 53&#39; 41&#34; West 102.10&nbsp;feet to the northeasterly line of the now vacated River Street (60&nbsp;feet wide) as said River Street is shown on said Record of
Survey Map; thence along said northeasterly line of River Street North 37&deg; 11&#39; 35&#34; West 173.10&nbsp;feet; thence leaving said northeasterly line of River Street
South 86&deg; 43&#39; 10&#34; West 22.45&nbsp;feet; thence North 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; West 129.77&nbsp;feet; thence North 60&deg;
57&#39; 13&#34; East 258.09&nbsp;feet to a point on the Southwesterly line of Locust Street; thence along said Southerwesterly line of Locust Street North 29&deg;
50&#39; 44&#34; West 70.00&nbsp;feet; thence North 60&deg; 57&#39; 13&#34; East 40.00&nbsp;feet to a point on the said centerline of Locust Street; thence
along the said centerline of Locust Street South 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; East 371.74&nbsp;feet to the True Point of Beginning.

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>PARCEL TWO:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

A non-exclusive easement for pedestrian and vehicular ingress and egress, utilities and construction, maintenance and use of a loading ramp as more particularly described in an instrument recorded
October&nbsp;12, 1994 as Instrument No.&nbsp;12684586, Official Records, being more particularly described as:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

Beginning at the point of intersection of the Southeasterly line of San Fernando Street (60&nbsp;feet wide) with the Southwesterly line of the now vacated Locust Street (80&nbsp;feet wide), as
said point is shown on that certain map entitled "Record of Survey of Properties bounded by San Carlos Street, San Fernando Street and Guadalupe River, Market-Almaden Streets," which map was filed for
record September&nbsp;27, 1966 in Book&nbsp;214 of Maps at page&nbsp;54, Santa Clara County Records; thence along said line of Locust Street South 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34;
East 27.58&nbsp;feet to the True Point of Beginning of this description; thence from said True Point of Beginning North 60&deg; 57&#39; 13&#34; East 40.00&nbsp;feet to a
point on the centerline of said Locust Street; thence Southeasterly along said centerline of Locust Street South 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; East 130.01&nbsp;feet; thence South
60&deg; 57&#39; 13&#34; West 40.00&nbsp;feet to a point on the said Southwesterly line of Locust Street; thence along said Southwesterly line of Locust Street North
29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; West 130.01&nbsp;feet to the True Point of Beginning.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

APN: 259-44-85<BR>
ARB: 259-44-x25, 41, 63, 65, 43, 64, X84, 84.01, 67.01, 81, 81.1, 66

</FONT></P>

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>Schedule 2 to</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Lease Supplement No. 1</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMITTED TITLE EXCEPTIONS</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><!-- SEQ.=5,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KE2301A.;31',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED<BR>
MASTER LEASE&#151;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO. 1</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
by and between</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC., as Landlord,</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>and</FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Graham&nbsp;&amp; James LLP<BR>
One Maritime Plaza, Suite&nbsp;300<BR>
San Francisco, CA 94111<BR>
Attention: Gary S. Hand, Esq.</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><!-- SEQ.=6,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=2,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KE2301A.;31',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED<BR>
MASTER LEASE&#151;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;1</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED MASTER LEASE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> ("Memorandum of Master Lease") is executed
as of August&nbsp;11, 1999 by and between </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC., </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>a Delaware corporation ("Landlord"), and</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>a Delaware corporation ("Tenant").

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>RECITALS</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant have executed that certain Amended, Restated and Consolidated Master Lease
("Amended and Restated Master Lease") and a Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1 (the "Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1") (the Amended and Restated Master Lease and Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1 are hereinafter
collectively referred to as the "Amended and Restated Master Lease"), which Amended and Restated Master Lease amends, restates and consolidates that certain Lease by and between Landlord and Tenant
dated October&nbsp;12, 1994, a Memorandum of which was recorded October&nbsp;12, 1994, as Series&nbsp;No. 12684589 in Official Records, Santa Clara County, California, covering a leasehold
interest in certain land located on the real property located in the City of San Jose, Santa Clara County, California as more particularly described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto and incorporated
herein by this reference ("Land") and the improvements which are located on said Land (the Land and improvements are referred to herein as the
"Parcel"); and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant desire to record notice of the Lease in the real estate records of Santa Clara County, California:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in consideration of the foregoing, Landlord and Tenant hereby declare as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Demise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord hereby leases the Parcel to Tenant and Tenant hereby leases the Parcels from
Landlord upon and subject to all the terms, covenants and conditions set forth in the Amended and Restated Master Lease and Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Expiration Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The term of the Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1 shall commence with respect to the
Parcel on the date hereof and shall expire on August&nbsp;11, 2004, unless extended pursuant to the terms of the Lease.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Option to Purchase.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant has an option to purchase the Parcel, as more particularly described in
the Amended and Restated Master Lease, at any time during the Term (including any extension thereof).</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Restrictions on Encumbrances.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord is prohibited from recording against the Parcel liens
(including, without limitation, deeds of trust), encumbrances, and other matters that would constitute exceptions to title, and from amending or modifying any of the foregoing that may exist now or
during the Term, as more particularly described in the Amended and Restated Master Lease. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord shall be permitted to execute and cause to be recorded the Rent
Purchasers' Deed of Trust as more particularly described in the Amended and Restated Master Lease and the Participation Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Restrictions on Transfers by Landlord.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to certain exceptions, Landlord may transfer its
interest in the Parcel to a third party subject to the restrictions which are set forth with more particularity in the Amended and Restated Master Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Ground Lease.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Land upon which the Improvements have been constructed and which is a part of this
Lease Supplement is subject to that certain Ground Lease between Landlord, as ground lessee, and the Redevelopment Agency of the City of San Jose, as ground lessor, dated October&nbsp;12, 1994, a
memorandum of which has been recorded with the Santa Clara County Recorder as Document No.&nbsp;12684585.
<!-- SEQ.=7,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KE2301A.;31',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Memorandum of Master Lease may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of
which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall comprise but a single instrument.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant have executed this Memorandum of Master Lease as of the date and year first written above.</FONT></P>
