<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXHIBIT B<BR>



</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;2</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;2 is dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999 and executed by and between SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC., a Delaware corporation
("Landlord"), and ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, a Delaware corporation ("Tenant").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord and Tenant have heretofore entered into that certain Amended, Restated and Consolidated Master Lease of Land and Improvements dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, relating to
the lease of certain parcels of real property (herein called the "Lease" and the defined terms therein being hereinafter used with the same meanings). The Lease provides for the execution and delivery
from time to time of Lease Supplements for the purpose of leasing individual Parcels under the Lease as and when delivered by Landlord in accordance with the terms thereof.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Land and Improvements represented by this Lease Supplement were originally leased by Landlord to Tenant by a lease dated August&nbsp;15, 1996, and the terms of such lease are
amended and restated in their entirety by the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and other good and valuable consideration, Landlord and Tenant hereby agree as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Landlord hereby delivers and leases to Tenant under the Lease and Tenant accepts and leases from Landlord under the Lease the Parcel described in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The Permitted Title Exceptions are described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;2 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;The original Lease Investment Balance for this Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2 is $75,797,872.34 and the Guaranteed Residual Value to this Lease Supplement No. 2 is
$70,534,352.54.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;The Lease Supplement Term commenced on as of the date hereof (the "Rent Commencement Date") and will expire on August&nbsp;11, 2004 (the "Expiration Date").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Tenant hereby confirms its agreement to pay Landlord Base Rent and Additional Rent for the Parcel during the Lease Supplement Term in accordance with</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Article&nbsp;VII </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant hereby confirms to Landlord that Tenant has accepted the Parcel and agrees that it shall be incorporated into the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;The Land upon which the Improvements have been constructed and which is a part of this Lease Supplement is subject to that certain Ground Lease between Landlord, as
ground lessee, and the Redevelopment Agency of the City of San Jose, as ground lessor, dated August&nbsp;15, 1996, a memorandum of which has been recorded with the Santa Clara County Recorder as
Document No.&nbsp;13410218.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;This Lease Supplement may be executed by the parties hereto in separate counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be an original, but all
such counterparts shall together constitute but one and the same instrument.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;This Lease Supplement is being delivered in the State of California and in all respects shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the
State of California, including all matters of construction, validity and performance.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
[Signatures begin on next page.]</FONT></P>

</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Landlord and Tenant have caused this Lease Supplement to be duly executed on the day and year first above written.</FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="48%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KF2301A.;9',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>Schedule 1 to</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Lease Supplement No. 2</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

DESCRIPTION OF PARCELS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>PARCEL ONE:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

Commencing at the intersection of the centerline of Locust Street (now vacated) with the centerline of Park Avenue, as said centerlines are shown on the Record of Survey recorded in Book&nbsp;214 of
Maps, at page&nbsp;54, Santa Clara County Records; thence North 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; West 79.00 feet along said centerline of Locust Street to the true point of beginning
of this description; thence from said true point of beginning North 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; West 501.75 feet along said centerline of Locust Street to a point thereon which
bears South 29&deg; 50&#39; 44&#34; East 58.18 feet from the intersection of said Locust Street centerline with the centerline of San Fernando Street, as said centerlines are
shown on said Record of Survey; thence leaving said Locust Street centerline North 60&deg; 57&#39; 13&#34; East 25.58 feet; thence South 29&deg; 50&#39;
44&#34; East 13.20 feet; thence at right angles North 60&deg; 09&#39; 16&#34; East 244.61 feet; thence South 29&deg; 53&#39; 36&#34; East 32.91
feet; thence South 30&deg; 40&#39; 51&#34; East 272.06 feet; thence along a tangent curve to the right, having a radius of 50.00 feet, through a central angle of
88&deg; 55&#39; 20&#34; an arc distance of 77.60 feet; thence South 58&deg; 14&#39; 29&#34; West 225.99&nbsp;feet to the true point of beginning.

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>PARCEL TWO:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

A non-exclusive easement for pedestrian and vehicular ingress and egress, utilities and construction, maintenance and use of a loading ramp as more particularly described in an instrument recorded
August&nbsp;15, 1996 as Instrument No.&nbsp;13410219, Official Records.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

APN: 259-44-69, 79<BR>
ARB: 259-44-x25, 25.01

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KF2301A.;9',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>Schedule 2 to</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Lease Supplement No. 2</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMITTED TITLE EXCEPTIONS</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><!-- SEQ.=5,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KF2301A.;9',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED<BR>
MASTER LEASE&#151;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;2</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2>Dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
by and between</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC., as Landlord,</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>and</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, as Tenant</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>After recording please return to:<BR></FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>Graham&nbsp;&amp; James LLP<BR>
One Maritime Plaza, Suite&nbsp;300<BR>
San Francisco, CA 94111<BR>
Attention: Gary S. Hand, Esq.</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><!-- SEQ.=6,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=2,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KF2301A.;9',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED<BR>
MASTER LEASE&#151;LEASE SUPPLEMENT NO.&nbsp;2</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>THIS MEMORANDUM OF AMENDED, RESTATED AND CONSOLIDATED MASTER LEASE </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>("Memorandum of Master Lease") is executed
as of August&nbsp;11, 1999 by and between </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>SUMITOMO BANK LEASING AND FINANCE, INC.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a Delaware corporation ("Landlord"), and</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, a Delaware corporation ("Tenant").

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>RECITALS</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant have executed that certain Amended, Restated and Consolidated Master Lease
("Amended and Restated Master Lease") and a Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2 (the "Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2") (the Amended and Restated Master Lease and Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2 are hereinafter
collectively referred to as the "Amended and Restated Master Lease"), which Amended and Restated Master Lease amends, restates and consolidates that certain Sublease by and between Landlord and Tenant
dated August&nbsp;15, 1996, a Memorandum of which was recorded August&nbsp;15, 1996, as Series&nbsp;No. 13410224 in Official Records, Santa Clara County, California, covering a leasehold
interest in certain land located on the real property located in the City of San Jose, Santa Clara County, California as more particularly described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>attached hereto and incorporated
herein by this reference ("Land") and the improvements which are located on said Land (the Land and improvements are referred to herein as the
"Parcel"); and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant desire to record notice of the Lease in the real estate records of Santa Clara County, California:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in consideration of the foregoing, Landlord and Tenant hereby declare as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Demise.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord hereby leases the Parcel to Tenant and Tenant hereby leases the Parcels from
Landlord upon and subject to all of the terms, covenants and conditions set forth in the Amended and Restated Master Lease and Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Expiration Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The term of the Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;2 shall commence with respect to the
Parcel on the date hereof and shall expire on August&nbsp;11, 2004, unless extended pursuant to the terms of the Lease.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Option to Purchase.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Tenant has an option to purchase the Parcel, as more particularly described in
the Amended and Restated Master Lease, at any time during the Term (including any extension thereof).</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Restrictions on Encumbrances.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Landlord is prohibited from recording against the Parcel liens
(including, without limitation, deeds of trust), encumbrances, and other matters that would constitute exceptions to title, and from amending or modifying any of the foregoing that may exist now or
during the Term, as more particularly described in the Amended and Restated Master Lease. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Landlord shall be permitted to execute and cause to be recorded the Rent
Purchasers' Deed
of Trust as more particularly described in the Amended and Restated Master Lease and the Participation Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Restrictions on Transfers by Landlord.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to certain exceptions, Landlord may transfer its
interest in the Parcel to a third party subject to the restrictions which are set forth with more particularity in the Amended and Restated Master Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Ground Lease.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;The Land upon which the Improvements have been constructed and which is a part of this
Lease Supplement is subject to that certain Ground Lease between Landlord, as ground lessee, and the Redevelopment Agency of the City of San Jose, as ground lessor, dated August&nbsp;15, 1996, a
memorandum of which has been recorded with the Santa Clara County Recorder as Document No.&nbsp;13410218.
<!-- SEQ.=7,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KF2301A.;9',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;15:04' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Memorandum of Master Lease may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of
which shall be deemed to be an original and all of which together shall comprise but a single instrument.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>Landlord and Tenant have executed this Memorandum of Master Lease as of the date and year first written above.</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds Managed By Weiss, Peck &amp; Greer

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government and its federal agencies may be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to Aaa rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or better. Long-term debt must be rated Baa and/or BBB or better by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's. Insured issues which are rated based on their insurance must be
rated Aaa by Moody's or AAA by Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-2,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Unrated Tax-Exempt Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Issues that are not rated may be purchased, if in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent
investment quality which meet one or more of the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Have been funded to maturity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Collateralized


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Backed by an Irrevocable Bank Letter of Credit which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by a Corporation which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Outstanding bonds are not rated; had a rating been applied for, the Advisor believes these securities would have received either an A long-term rating or
an A1/P1 short-term rating


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by an Investment Contract from a Bank, Corporation, or Insurance Company which meets the requisite quality standards.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrated securities will be limited to 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis. Only funds that seek to maintain a net asset value of $1.00 and maintain investment parameters that are at least as restrictive as those of the manager's will be
permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction-rate preferred stocks shall be limited to 15% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated AAA by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50%
of the Portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insured municipal securities rated AAA based on their insurance are limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested in securities rated Baa and/or BBB by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio. Municipal securities that may have been
funded to maturity in U.S. Government or its agencies' securities may be up to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 3 years.
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For securities that have put dates, reset dates, auction dates, or trade based on their average maturity, the put date, auction date, reset date, or average maturity will be used
instead of the final maturity date for duration and maturity guideline purposes.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The average duration of the portfolio will range from 1.0 to 2.0 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at each month's end. A complete and detailed listing of all securities held
for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The performance benchmark for this portfolio will be calculated as the average of the Bankers Trust Tax-Exempt Tender note and Lehman Bros. 3-year Tax-Exempt
Bond Index. This benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key objective. A
negative return of 2% or more on a 12-month rolling basis will trigger immediate review of the manager and the investment strategy.

</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE LIQUIDITY ACCOUNT<BR>
WPG 9041

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds managed By Weiss, Peck &amp; Greer

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government and its federal agencies may be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to Aaa rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or better. Long-term debt
<!-- SEQ.=6,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-5,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->
must be rated Baa and/or BBB or better by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's. Insured issues which are rated based on their insurance must be rated Aaa by Moody's or AAA by Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Unrated Tax-Exempt Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Issues that are not rated may be purchased, if in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent
investment quality which meet one or more of the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Have been funded to maturity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Collateralized


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Backed by an Irrevocable Bank Letter of Credit which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by a Corporation which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Outstanding bonds are not rated; had a rating been applied for, the Advisor believes these securities would have received either an A long-term rating or
an A1/P1 short-term rating


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by an Investment Contract from a Bank, Corporation, or Insurance Company which meets the requisite quality standards.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrated securities will be limited to 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis. Only funds that seek to maintain a net asset value of $1.00 and maintain investment parameters that are at least as restrictive as those of the manager's will be
permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction-rate preferred stocks shall be limited to 15% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated AAA by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50%
of the Portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insured municipal securities rated AAA based on their insurance are limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested in securities rated Baa and/or BBB by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio. Municipal securities that may have been
funded to maturity in U.S. Government or its agencies' securities may be up to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.
<!-- SEQ.=7,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-6,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum maturity of any issue in the portfolio may not exceed 1.5 years.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For securities that have put dates, reset dates, auction dates, or trade based on their average maturity, the put date, auction date, reset date, or average maturity will be used
instead of the final maturity date for duration and maturity guideline purposes.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum duration of the portfolio may not exceed 6 months.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at each month's end. A complete and detailed listing of all securities held
for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benchmark for the portfolio will be the Merrill Lynch 3-Month Bill.

</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds Managed By Sterling Capital Management

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government, its federal agencies may also be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to AAA rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A-1 by Standard &amp; Poor's. Long-term debt must be rated A or better.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All general obligations of governmental entities bearing a long-term rating of A or better or have a short-term rating of SP-1 or VMIG1 or better by Standard &amp; Poor's Corporation or
Moody's Investors Service, Inc.
<!-- SEQ.=9,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-8,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All revenue obligations issued in conjunction with governmental entities described above bearing a long-term rating of A or short-term rating of SP-1 or VMIG1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or
Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pre-refunded municipal issues are permissible if, in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent investment quality and have been funded to maturity or are collateralized.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, the maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction rate preferred stocks rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's shall be limited to 25% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated A or better
by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities can be up to 100% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Asset-backed securities shall be limited to 10% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 2 years. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 2 years will be
permissible if the rate adjustment occurs within 12 months and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 2 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The average duration of the portfolio will range from .5 to 1.25 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.
<!-- SEQ.=10,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-9,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at Adobe System's fiscal month end. A complete and detailed listing of all
securities held for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are
the key performance objective. The 1-Year Municipal Index will be the benchmark used for performance measurement of this portfolio. The portfolio will not be permitted to have negative returns on a
12-month rolling average basis.

</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADDENDUM TO INVESTMENT POLICY AGREEMENT

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Addendum is being made this 15th day of October, 1997 with respect to that certain Investment Policy Agreement dated December&nbsp;21, 1994 between
Adobe Systems, Inc. ("Client") and Sterling Capital Management Company ("Advisor").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Addendum amends the Investment Policy Agreement, and in the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Addendum and the provisions
of the Investment Policy Agreement, the provisions of this Addendum shall supersede and control.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Maturity Restrictions", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 15 months. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 15 months will be permissible if the rate adjustment occurs
within 15 months and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 15 months.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The Maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 5 years. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 5 years will be permissible if the rate adjustment occurs within 5
years and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 5 years.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

No more than 30% of the securities in the Core Portfolio will have final maturities in excess of 3.5 years.

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Duration", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

This average duration of the portfolio will range from 3 to 6 months.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The average duration of the portfolio will range from 1.3 to 2.3 years.

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Benchmark", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key performance objective. The
benchmark for performance measurement of this portfolio will consist of 38% 1-Year Bond Buyer General Obligation Municipal and 62% 7-Day Floating Rate Municipal Index. The portfolio will not be
permitted to have negative returns on a 12-month rolling average basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

the benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key performance objective. The
2-Year Bond Buyer General Obligation Municipal Index will be the benchmark used for performance measurement of this portfolio. The portfolio will not be permitted to have negative returns on a
12-month rolling average basis.
<!-- SEQ.=12,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-11,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The undersigned do hereby acknowledge and agree to the aforementioned addendum to the Investment Policy Agreement between Adobe Systems, Inc. and Sterling Capital Management Company.

</FONT></P>

</B></FONT></P>
