<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY DESCRIPTION: Investments

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>1.0&nbsp;PURPOSE

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Investment Policy is to establish a worldwide Policy and guidelines to direct the investment of temporarily idle or surplus cash of the Company. Surplus cash shall
be defined as funds exceeding the operational requirements of the Company and not immediately required for working capital, capital investments, debt repayment or other financial obligation. The basic
objectives of the Investment Policy are, in order of priority:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safety and preservation of invested funds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Liquidity of investments that is sufficient to meet the Company's cash flow requirements


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Attainment of a market rate of return on invested funds that is consistent with the stated objectives

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>2.0&nbsp;SCOPE

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Policy shall apply to Adobe Systems Incorporated and all majority owned entities. This Policy shall specifically apply to all funds managed in-house by Adobe. In separate
attached exhibits, additional guidelines and/or variations on this Policy are included for funds managed by outside investment managers as well as Adobe's foreign subsidiaries.</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>This policy provides for investments in U.S. dollar denominated instruments only.</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This policy applies to:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>All Adobe Companies</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;Domestic Adobe Companies (in the U.S. and Canada)

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;International Adobe Companies

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;Other (describe:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;)


</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.0</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>RESPONSIBILITY</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Board of Directors is responsible to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Direct the Corporate Investment Committee

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Corporate Investment Committee is responsible to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Establish and maintain the Corporate Investment Policy;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Periodically review the investment guidelines and policies, as required by changing conditions, but at least annually;
<!-- SEQ.=14,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-13,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Submit any recommended changes to that policy as needed to the Board of Directors for approval;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Committee shall consist of the President, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, Assistant Treasurer and Cash Manager.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) has the responsibility for:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Executing the investment policy as well as designate those who can execute it;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Administrative and operating approval for establishing any and all bank accounts, safekeeping/custody accounts, and brokerage accounts;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Selection of or changes in investment managers;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Monitoring investment results of all investment managers engaged, as well as results of in-house investment activities;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Advance approval of all investment transactions outside the parameters of the current investment policy, and notification to the Board of Directors of such transactions, and


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Control systems and procedures that provide for an appropriate level if segregation of duties related to the conduct and accounting for investment activity.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Treasurer has the responsibility for:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investment of the excess cash in accordance with the guidelines specified in this policy;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Custody of securities as well as maintenance of bank/brokerage accounts required for investment trading, and the underlying accounting for such transactions;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Reporting the status of investments to the Corporate Investment Committee on a quarterly basis, and more frequently in the event of unusual and material events in the marketplace
that would effect the status of the portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Managing all in-house funds in accordance with this investment policy as well as directing funds to any Investment Advisor/Management firm which has been approved by the CFO.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For purposes of compliance, the investments managed by any Investment Advisor/Management firm shall not be combined with investments made by the Treasurer but shall be considered
separately.

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>4.0&nbsp;POLICIES

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Statement of Objectives

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The surplus cash of the Company will be invested in accordance with principles of sound investment management and this Investment Policy. Any exceptions to this policy will have to be
approved, in writing, by the Chief Financial Officer.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The basic objectives of the Investment Policy are, in order of priority:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safety and preservation of invested funds;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Liquidity of investments that is sufficient to meet the Company's cash flow requirements;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Attainment of a market rate of return on invested funds that is consistent with the stated objectives.
<!-- SEQ.=15,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-14,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Overall Risk Profile

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The above mentioned objectives and the methods that the Company will use to achieve them are described below: </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>It is noted, however, that these guidelines will
remain applicable until the Company's cash position and outlook change significantly, at which time, the guidelines should be reviewed and, if appropriate, revised.</I></FONT>

</P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe will ensure the safety and preservation of its invested funds by limiting default risk, market risk and reinvestment risk.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will mitigate the effects of default risk (the failure by a debtor to pay interest or principal when due) by:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Pre-qualifying all financial institutions and security dealers with whom the Company will do business;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Diversify the investment portfolio to minimize the adverse effects of the failure of any one issuer or guarantor;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Monitor the portfolio and trends in the business climate on a timely basis to anticipate and respond appropriately to a significant reduction in credit rating of any investment
issuer, guarantor or depository.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Invest only the safest type of securities.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market risk occurs because the value of any security can rise or fall. Reinvestment risk will occur when a security matures or is called and
yields have declined. The Company will balance the effects of market risk and reinvestment risk by structuring the investment portfolio so that security maturities approximate cash requirements,
thereby avoiding the need to sell securities in the open market prior to their maturity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will structure its investment portfolio so that securities mature to meet anticipated cash requirements (static liquidity). In
addition, the portfolio will include only securities with active secondary or resale markets (dynamic liquidity), providing liquidity through sale of a security should that be necessary.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yield on the company's investment portfolio is of great importance, though of secondary importance when compared to the safety and liquidity
objectives described above. Investments are structured in accordance with safety and liquidity in anticipation of earning a market rate of return relative to the risk being assumed. It may
occasionally be necessary for the company to sell a security prior to maturity to meet anticipated cash needs. This Policy does not exclude selling securities for realizing profits, but this is not
the primary goal of function of this Policy.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As described above, the Company's investment portfolio will be comprised of securities that provide sufficient cashflow to meet anticipated cash
requirements. Because cash requirement forecasts are necessarily uncertain, the maturity of investments in the portfolio will tend to be shorter than the actual cash requirements forecast. Maturities
may also be affected by liquidity needs, changes in interest rate environment or other economic or business needs. The following maturity guidelines will apply to individual investment transactions
and to the portfolio as a whole:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The weighted-average maturity is the average length of time from the settlement date to the maturity of the investments in the portfolio weighted according to the face value of the
investments. The weighted-average of the portfolio will not exceed one year.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For purposes of determining the weighted-average maturity calculation, the calculated weighted-average life (WAL) will be used for any asset-backed securities in the portfolio. If
<!-- SEQ.=16,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-15,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->
one or more Investment Managers are used, separate duration requirements will be established under their specific Investment Policies. In addition, a maturity by definition shall include puts,
announced calls, auctions or other structural features which allow the Company to redeem the investment(s) at a quantifiable price consistent with liquidity, safety, and preservation of capital.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Individual security maturities will not exceed two years.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may invest in obligations of foreign branches of U.S. banks (Eurodollars) and U.S. branches of foreign banks (Yankee dollars) as
well as U.S. denominated commercial paper of foreign institutions. These foreign investments involve additional risks not found in investments of U.S. institutions. These risks, commonly known as
Foreign Credit and Sovereign Risk, may include unfavorable political and economic developments such as interest limitations, withholding taxes or the seizure of foreign assets.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign Credit Risk is defined as the strength and security of the institution's national economy. Sovereign Risk is defined as the political
stability and security of the country in which the assets are domiciled. For instance, a Japanese Eurodollar CD is exposed to the Foreign Credit Risk of Japan and it is exposed to the Sovereign Risk
of being domiciled "offshore" in Grand Cayman. Foreign Credit Risk is minimized by selecting very highly rated and respected foreign institutions. Investments are limited to only those international
institutions whose ratings qualify as "Investment Grade." In addition, Foreign Credit Risk is also managed by assigning foreign country exposure limits. These limits are based on an assessment of the
country's overall political and economic stability and are as follows:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Japan, Germany, United Kingdom, France, Canada, Switzerland, Netherlands 25%&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

All others 10%

</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sovereign Risk will be minimized by limiting the domicile of Eurodollar deposits to generally accepted safe havens, such as London, The
Netherlands, Toronto, Montreal, Nassau and Grand Cayman.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will maintain a diversified portfolio consistent with the following:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other than U.S. Treasury and Federal Agency Securities, investments in any one obligation shall not exceed $15,000,000;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other than U.S. Treasury and Federal Agency Securities, investments in the obligations of any one issuer or guarantor may not exceed 10% of the value of holdings of any fund
portfolio or $15,000,000, whichever is greater;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For corporate obligations, investments in any one industry group shall not exceed 25% of the fund portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investments in entities of issuers of any one foreign country shall not exceed 25% of the fund portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investments in the following security structures (unless backed by U.S. Treasury or Federal Agency Securities) shall be limited to 25% of the fund portfolio or $30,000,000,
whichever is greater: Money Market Funds, Repurchase Agreements;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
At least 25% of the portfolio will have a maturity of 90 days or less.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Temporarily idle or surplus funds, available funds, are funds not needed for immediate cash requirements. Funds not so needed are available for
investing in instruments of appropriate quality and maturity. Funds that are raised via debt are available for investment until such time as they are required for the purpose for which they were
borrowed. However, any borrowing of
<!-- SEQ.=17,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-16,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->
funds for the sole purpose of leveraging the portfolio by investing those funds is strictly prohibited.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may not engage in any non-business related investment activity that would be considered speculative according to the principles of
conservative investment management, whether or not that activity is specifically prohibited elsewhere in this Policy.


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safekeeping

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments will be held in a custodial account, a safekeeping account or a broker's segregated account. All of the U.S. institutions qualified to do business with the Company are
authorized to hold investments in safekeeping on behalf of the Company. All investments owned by the Company will be held in safekeeping by a dealer or financial institution so qualified. For Outside
Investment Managers, a safekeeping/custody account may be established with an eligible bank or trust company to accept delivery of all investments made by the Investment Manager. Corporate Treasury
will reconcile the safekeeping/ custody account statement to the investment report submitted by the Investment Manager on a monthly basis.


</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
External Investment Managers

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon approval of the Chief Financial Officer, the Company may utilize outside fund managers to manage investments under the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must manage a minimum of $500 million for other institutional clients;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must have an average performance for the prior three years exceeding either the average Donoghue index for the period for the short duration funds or the Merrill Lynch
1-3 year Treasury Index for the medium duration funds;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must provide the Company with requisite reporting;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must comply with the Performance Reporting Standards of AIMR;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The maximum amount of funds under one external investment manager shall not exceed $300 million;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The intent is to treat all investments as "Available-for-sale" as defined in SFAS 115, unless otherwise designated.

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Internal Investments

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All investments made shall be consistent with the investment criteria of this policy unless prior consent has been received from the CFO.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Safekeeping and custodial arrangements may be made with investment banks who qualify under the stated requirements of Approved Securities
Dealers.


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Subsidiaries and Regional Offices (for those subsidiaries without specific investment guidelines)

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments shall be limited to interest bearing deposits or similar investments of a branch bank where the subsidiary/entity has an existing
operating account that has been previously approved by the Chief Financial Officer. These instruments must be direct obligations of banks where the Company does business.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments shall have a maximum maturity of 90 days and may only be executed by persons who have signature authority on accounts at that bank.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Specific investments or custodian relationships or procedures that are not consistent with this Policy can be executed or implemented only if
approved by the CFO in advance, in writing.
<!-- SEQ.=18,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-17,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.7</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Controls

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reporting requirements. Each month confirmation statements of activity and position will be sent to the Finance department for all investments
managed internally and externally.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Someone who does not have investment authority will reconcile all confirmations to bank or custody account statements.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate Treasury will report individual and combined results to the Investment Committee on a quarterly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate Treasury will prepare a Report of compliance at the end of each quarter for all investments. In addition, compliance will be monitored
on a daily or weekly basis as reports and confirmations are received.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appropriate performance benchmarks will be established for each segment of managed funds. Analysis of performance will be done on a quarterly
basis and include: credit quality of each issue, credit quality of any financial institution that provides a credit enhancement for the underlying security, maturity/liquidity, diversification, total
after tax return, reports of any capital gains/losses.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The "Investment Report" will be prepared on a quarterly basis for distribution to the Investment Committee and will at a minimum contain the
following information:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Inventory of portfolio investments as of the date of the report;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Average portfolio maturity;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Rate of return on investments;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Rate of return on the particular portfolio as compared to an appropriate benchmark;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
SFAS No. 115 reports;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Any violations or exceptions to the Investment Policy, including the reasons for and amounts of the violations or exceptions;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Status of any investments that might require management attention (such as investments affected by a credit rating change, or similar circumstances that could have an affect on the
value and collectibility of the investment);


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Summary of all international investments, including rates of return, average maturity and after tax yields;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Verification of securities held in safekeeping.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On a quarterly basis the Investment Report will be summarized for distribution to the Board of Directors.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Investment Policy will be reviewed annually, at a minimum, to ensure that it remains consistent with the overall objectives of the Company
and with current financial trends. The Policy may be reviewed and updated more frequently if conditions dictate. Proposed amendments to the Policy should be prepared by the Treasurer and reviewed and
ratified by the Corporate investment Committee, the CFO and the Board of Directors.
<!-- SEQ.=19,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-18,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.0&nbsp;PROCEDURE

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>6.0&nbsp;EXCEPTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
This Policy provides guidelines for the management of the investment portfolio. Under some circumstances, investment transactions that are appropriate for the Company and entirely
within the spirit of this Investment Policy as described may not fall within the prescribed quantitative guidelines contained in this Investment Policy. It may be determined that an investment
transaction is in the best interest of the Company and is consistent with the objectives of this Investment Policy, in that case, the transaction may be permitted even though it is not consistent with
the quantitative guidelines, subject to the following controls:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Whenever a transaction that is an exception to the quantitative guidelines is made, it will be approved in writing by the Chief Financial Officer prior to being executed and will be
reported to the Investment Committee at the next scheduled meeting.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
It is the responsibility of the Treasurer to immediately report to the Investment Committee any credit downgrade, default, bankruptcy or event which may affect the investment's
value. The Investment Committee shall analyze viable elections with respect to the investment in question. Securities of investments that no longer meet the criteria of this Policy should be sold or
exchanged when market conditions permit realization of reasonable value. The Investment Committee shall decide an appropriate strategy regarding such an investment. Any investments or portfolios of
investments, which are assumed as the result of an acquisition or merger, will be evaluated for compliance with this Policy. If necessary, a plan for returning the portfolio to compliance under
guidelines will be established. A workout period will be established for this return to compliance.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>7.0&nbsp;DEFINITIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This section of the Investment Policy describes the securities and investments in which the Company is authorized to invest. Appendix A lists the limits and diversification
requirements for each investment.


</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>United States Government Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Marketable securities which are a direct obligation of the U.S. Government, issued by
or guaranteed as to the principal and interest by the U.S. Government and supported by the full faith and credit of the United States. Included but not limited to U.S. Treasury Bills, Notes and Bonds.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>United States Government Agency Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Debt securities issued by Government sponsored enterprises, Federal agencies
and certain international institutions which are not direct obligations of the United States, but involve Government sponsorship and are fully guaranteed by Government agencies or enterprises or have
implicit guarantees because of their relationship to the U.S. Government. Including but not limited to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Government National Mortgage Association (GNMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Farm Credit Bank (FFCB)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Student Loan Marketing Association (SLMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Agency for International Development (AID)
<!-- SEQ.=20,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-19,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements/Reverse Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Collateralized loans by the Company to the seller (a bank, broker or
primary dealer in U.S. Government securities) secured by the securities transferred to the purchaser (the Company). They must always be fully collateralized by U.S. Treasury or U.S. agency
obligations. Collateral must be market priced greater than the invested amount at the time of purchase (usually 102%).


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Bank Money Instruments</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Obligations of commercial banks. Including but not limited to negotiable certificates of deposit
(domestic, Yankee and Euro CDs), Banker's Acceptances, Bank Time Deposits (domestic or Euro). Deposits placed with offshore branches of approved banks (Euro CDs and TDs)


</FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
will be limited to branches located in the British Commonwealth, including London, Toronto, Montreal, Nassau, and Grand Cayman.


</FONT></P>
</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Short-term Corporate Instruments</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Commercial paper and other short-term, unsecured promissory notes issued by
corporations. Eligible investments must have at least a short-term rating of A-1 (Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's) or P-1 (Moody's) and/or a long-term debt rating of at least of A by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's
or Moody's. Medium-term notes and Master notes must have a long-term rating of at least A by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's or Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Direct obligations of and obligations fully guaranteed by a state, territory, or a possession of
the United States, or any political subdivision of any of the foregoing, or of the District of Columbia as will as obligations of any county or other local governmental body within the U.S. Including
but not limited to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Tax-exempt commercial paper


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Short Term Notes


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Bond Anticipation Notes (BANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Tax Anticipation Notes (TANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Revenue Anticipation Notes (RANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
General Obligations (GOs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Variable Rate Demand Notes (Low Floaters)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Revenue Bonds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Put Bonds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other Municipal Notes


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Weekly Floaters

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approved credit enhancements include:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Bank Letter of Credit (LOC) of a bank rated A-1/P-1


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Insurance by MBIA, FGIC, AMBAC


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Escrowed to maturity in U.S. Treasuries

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.7</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction Rate Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Tax exempt bond funds which are leveraged and highly collateralized, whose shares are sold by
utilizing a Dutch Auction or other remarketing mechanisms, thus allowing the security to trade at its par value at each reset date. They must be rated at least AAA by S&amp;P or Aaa by Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.8</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Preferred Stock</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Preferred stock with a variable dividend rate which is determined through a Dutch Auction
mechanism allowing the security to trade at par on the auction dates. These


</FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=21,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=D-20,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301B.;53',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
securities are eligible for the intercorporate Dividend-Received Deduction (70% tax-exempt for federal income tax purposes) as long as the security is held a minimum of 46 days and is not
debt-financed.


</FONT></P>
</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.9</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction Variable Rate Bonds and Notes</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Floating rate municipal bonds or notes on which interest is exempt from federal
income tax and are sold using a Dutch Auction rate reset mechanism. They must be rated AAA by S&amp;P or Aaa by Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.10</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Mutual Funds</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Shares of an open-end investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940
as amended. The investments of that company should comply with the SEC regulations under Rule&nbsp;2a-7 including:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Maintain constant net asset value


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Provide daily liquidity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Average weighted maturity not to exceed 90 days


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Individual instrument maturity not to exceed 13 months


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
95% of the portfolio must possess the highest possible rating (or equivalent) and the remaining 5% will possess the second highest rating.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

</B></FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX B

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPROVED BANKING INSTITUTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Banks authorized to conduct general investment business with the Company must meet the following credit requirements:&nbsp;*

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>U.S. BANKS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is one of the 50 largest U.S. Banks (by total capital as ranked by Institutional Investor)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Thomson BankWatch rating no lower than "B"


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is a member of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporations


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The commercial bank's long-term rating must be at least "A" by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's or by Moody's Investors Service, or a comparable rating agency

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>INTERNATIONAL BANKS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is one of the 100 largest banks in the world (by total capital, as ranked by Institutional Investor)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Thompson BankWatch rating no lower than "B"


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Limited to banks with over $20 billion in assets

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>*</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Banks which do not meet these criteria may be used in some circumstances, such as in a case where banking services from a qualified bank are not available. However, approval must be
obtained in writing from the Chief Financial Officer and documentation must be received as to why a qualified bank was not used.

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>Bank Credit Analysis

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Investment Policy shall employ the bank credit rating services of Thomson BankWatch as a benchmark for its bank credit analysis. BankWatch's ratings are based upon a qualitative
and quantitative analysis of all segments of the organization. The ratings are BankWatch's assessment of the likelihood of receiving payment of principal and interest on a timely basis. The ratings
incorporate BankWatch's opinion as to the vulnerability of the bank to adverse developments which may impact the market's perception of the company, thereby affecting the marketability of its
securities.

</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXHIBIT H<BR>

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>PRICING GRID

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I><!-- SEQ.=29,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=H-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KG2301E.;49',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;14:33' --></I></B></FONT></P>
</DD></DL>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>The Applicable Margin will be determined based upon the Lessee's quarterly calculation of Total Funded Debt to EBITDA as follows:

</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="87%" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN=BOTTOM>
<TH WIDTH="6%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1><B>Level</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>

<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="14%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1><B>Applicable Base<BR>
Rate Margin</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="16%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1><B>Lessor<BR>
Contribution Rate</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="6%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>I</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>&lt;.45x</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>75.0 bps</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>0 bps</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>162.5 bps</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="6%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>II</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="42%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>&gt;.45x - Less than or equal to&nbsp;.75x</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>87.5 bps</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>0 bps</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="16%" ALIGN=RIGHT><FONT SIZE=2>175 bps</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="6%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>III</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

credit, net interest rate and currency swap liabilities, etc.

("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Landlord</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the financial institutions listed in Schedule&nbsp;I to the Participation Agreement (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Rent

"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lease</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") between Landlord and Tenant. Unless otherwise indicated, all terms defined in the Participation Agreement or the Lease have the same respective
meanings when used herein.</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX A</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>I.&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>DEFINITIONS</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition Price.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Acquisition Price" shall mean, as to any Rent Purchaser an amount equal to
such Rent Purchaser's Percentage of the Commitment Amount.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Actual/360 Basis.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Actual/360 Basis" shall mean interest calculated on the basis of a 360-day
year and charged on the basis of actual days elapsed for any whole or partial month in which interest is being calculated.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Amount.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Additional Amount" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;8.4 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Charges.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Additional Charges" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;8.4 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Rent.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Additional Rent" shall mean any amounts, other than Base Rent, which are
payable by Tenant to Landlord, Administrative Agent or any other Entity as required under the Lease, any Lease Supplement or any other Operative Document, specifically including, but without
limitation, any rent or other amounts payable by the ground lessee under any Ground Lease, payment of interest on any overdue payments of Tenant to either Landlord or Administrative Agent on behalf of
the Rent Purchasers, payment of the Guaranteed Residual Value, the Purchase Price, all indemnification payments payable by Tenant, and all Break Funding Costs.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administrative Agent.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Administrative Agent" shall mean ABN AMRO Bank N.V., as agent for the
Rent Purchasers, collectively, and its successors and permitted assigns in interest.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administrative Agent's Wire Transfer Instructions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Administrative Agent's Wire Transfer
Instructions" shall mean the following with respect to payments to be made to Administrative Agent:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>For Credit to ABN AMRO Bank N.V.:</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
ABN AMRO Bank N.V.<BR>
New York, New York<BR>
ABA No: 026009580<BR>
F/O ABN AMRO Bank, N.V.<BR>
Chicago Branch CPU<BR>
A/C No.: 650-001-1789-41<BR>
Reference: CPU 00457353 Adobe Synthetic Lease</FONT></P>
</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advance.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Advance" shall mean, with respect to Lease Supplement No.&nbsp;1 and Lease
Supplement No.&nbsp;2 executed as of the Date of Lease, the Commitment Amount, which shall include (a)&nbsp;costs incurred in connection with the making of the Lease and paid by Landlord or
Administrative Agent (including reasonable attorneys fees and costs in connection with preparation of the Operative Documents, plus all costs required to return the Original Security Deposit and the
collateral under the Original Pledge Agreement, to terminate the Original Pledge Agreement and the Original Custodial Agreement and to reconvey the Original Adobe Deed of Trust), transaction costs
(including title charges and professional fees and expenses) and other reasonable professional fees, arrangement fees, appraisal fees, inspection, testing and permitting fees, reasonable travel
expense for inspections and insurance; and (b)&nbsp;all amounts previously advanced pursuant to the Original Leases.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Affiliate.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Affiliate" shall mean, with respect to any Entity, (a)&nbsp;each Entity that,
directly or indirectly, owns or controls, whether beneficially or as a trustee, guardian or other fiduciary, ten percent (10%) or more of any class of Equity Securities of such Entity, (b)&nbsp;each
Entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with such Entity or any Affiliate of such Entity or (c)&nbsp;each of such Entity's officers, directors, general partners and, if
such Entity is a joint venture organized as a separate legal entity, joint venturers having powers comparable to a general partner; provided, however, that in no case shall any of the following
Entities be deemed to be an Affiliate of Tenant or any of its Subsidiaries for purposes of the
<!-- SEQ.=1,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KH2301A.;2',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:58' -->
Operative Documents: (i)&nbsp;Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser or (ii)&nbsp;the general partner of any VC Partnership which would otherwise be deemed an Affiliate solely
because it acts as general partner and controls such VC Partnership. For the purposes of this definition, "control" of an Entity shall mean the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to
direct or cause the direction of its management or policies.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amended Deeds of Trust.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Amended Deeds of Trust" shall mean those certain amended deeds of
trust in favor of Landlord, dated July&nbsp;[&nbsp;&nbsp;], 1999, executed by Tenant in favor of Landlord, which Amended Deeds of Trust shall amend each of the Original
Deeds of Trust.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Applicable Environmental Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Applicable Environmental Laws" shall have the meaning set forth
in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;10.1(b) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appraisal.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Appraisal" shall have the meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;1.9 of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignee Rent Purchaser.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Assignee Rent Purchaser" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;7.4(b) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignor Rent Purchaser.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Assignor Rent Purchaser" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;7.4(b) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Assignment" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;7.4(b) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment Agreement.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Assignment Agreement" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;7.4(b) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base Rate.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Base Rate" shall mean, on any day, the greater of (a)&nbsp;the "Prime Rate,"
which is the per annum rate publicly announced by ABN AMRO Bank N.V. at its Chicago Office as in effect on such date and is determined by ABN AMRO Bank N.V. from time to time as a means of pricing
credit extensions to some customers and is neither directly tied to any external rate of interest or index nor necessarily the lowest rate of interest charged by ABN AMRO Bank N.V. at any given time
for any particular class of customers or credit extensions, and (b)&nbsp;one-half percent (0.50%) </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>the "Federal Funds Rate" for such day, which
Federal Funds Rate for such day is the per annum rate set forth in the weekly statistical release designated as H.15(519), or any successor publication, published by the Board of Governors of the
Federal Reserve System (including any such successor publication, "H.15 (519)") for such day opposite the caption "Federal Funds (Effective)" for such day. If on any relevant day, a rate is not yet
published in H.15 (519), the Federal Funds Rate for such day shall be the rate set forth in the daily statistical release designated as the Composite 3:30 p.m. Quotations for U.S. Government
Securities, or any successor publication, published by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York (including any such successor publication, the "Composite 3:30&nbsp;p.m. Quotations") for such day under
the caption "Federal Funds Effective Rate". If on any relevant day, a rate is not yet published in either H.15 (519) or the Composite 3:30&nbsp;p.m. Quotations, the Federal Funds Rate for such day
shall be the arithmetic mean, as determined by Administrative Agent, of the rates quoted to Administrative Agent for such day by three (3)&nbsp;Federal funds brokers of recognized standing selected
by Administrative
Agent, and Administrative Agent shall promptly provide written evidence of such calculation to Tenant. Any change in the Base Rate resulting from a change in the Prime Rate shall become effective on
the Business Day on which each change in the Prime Rate occurs.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base Rent.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Base Rent" shall mean, as of a Rent Payment Date, that amount equal to the
following:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;for each Portion of the then outstanding Rent Purchasers Contribution, the product obtained by multiplying the Rent Purchasers Contribution Rate for such Portion by
the amount of such Portion, which amount is then prorated for the monthly rental period in question on an Actual/360 Basis; plus</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;from the Date of Lease to August&nbsp;15, 2003, the product obtained by multiplying the Landlord Contribution Rate by the then outstanding
Landlord Contribution, which amount is then prorated for the monthly rental period in question on a 30/360 Basis and, (ii)&nbsp;from and after August&nbsp;15, 2003, for each Portion of the then
outstanding Landlord Contribution, the product
<!-- SEQ.=2,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KH2301A.;2',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:58' -->
obtained by multiplying the Landlord Contribution Rate for such Portion by the amount of such Portion, which amount is then prorated for the monthly rental period in question on an Actual/360 Basis.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Break Funding Costs.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Break Funding Costs" shall mean all costs, losses and expenses of
Landlord, Administrative Agent or any Rent Purchaser (including all such costs, losses and expenses in respect of any interest paid or premium or penalty incurred by such Entity to lenders or
otherwise), as a result of unscheduled payments or the exercise of the Purchase Option pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;20.1 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Lease, other than on a
Rent Payment Date, and which may include losses incurred by Landlord, Administrative Agent or such Rent Purchaser as a result of funding and other contracts entered into by Landlord, Administrative
Agent or such Rent Purchaser in connection with the transactions contemplated under the Operative Documents, or such costs, losses and expenses of Landlord resulting from unscheduled payments as such
payments relate to any Rate Contracts in effect upon the Date of Lease for the Landlord Contribution.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Building.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Building" shall mean any building or buildings, structures and facilities now or
hereafter located on the Land covered by a Lease Supplement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Business Days.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Business Days" shall mean every day of the week excepting Saturday and Sunday,
and excluding holidays when banks in California, Illinois and New York are generally closed for business, unless otherwise expressly stated and, if such Business Day is relating to the LIBOR Rate or
the calculation of the LIBOR Rate, a day that dealings in U.S. Dollar Deposits are carried out in the London Interbank market.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capital Leases.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Capital Leases" shall mean any and all lease obligations that, in accordance
with GAAP, are required to be capitalized on the books of a lessee.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change of Control.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Change of Control" shall mean</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;With respect to Tenant, (i)&nbsp;the acquisition after the Date of Lease by any person or group of persons (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;13 or 14 of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (as amended, the "Exchange Act")) of (A) beneficial ownership (within the meaning of Rule&nbsp;13d-3 promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission under the
Exchange Act) of fifty percent (50%) or more of the outstanding Equity Securities of Tenant entitled to vote for members of the board of directors, or (B)&nbsp;all or substantially all of the assets
of Tenant; or (ii)&nbsp;during any period of twelve (12) consecutive calendar months, individuals who are directors of Tenant on the first day of such period ("Initial Directors") and any directors
of Tenant who are specifically approved by two-thirds of the Initial Directors and previously-approved Directors shall cease to constitute a majority of the Board of Directors of Tenant before the end
of such period; or</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;With respect to any Material Subsidiary, Tenant shall cease to own, directly or indirectly, one hundred percent (100%) of the Equity Securities of such Subsidiary
except for nominal amounts of stock necessary to do business in certain jurisdictions outside the United States.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change of Law.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Change of Law" shall have the meaning set forth in the definition of "Landlord
Contribution Rate."</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;City.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"City" shall mean the City in which a Parcel is located.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Commitment Amount.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Commitment Amount," as of the Date of Lease, shall mean&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
and no/100 Dollars ($&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;).</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contingent Obligation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Contingent Obligation" shall mean, with respect to any Entity,
(a)&nbsp;any Guaranty Obligation of that Entity; and (b)&nbsp;any direct or indirect obligation or liability, contingent or otherwise, of that Entity (i)&nbsp;in respect of any Surety Instrument
(as defined in the definition of "Indebtedness") issued for the account of that Entity or as to which that Entity is otherwise liable for reimbursement of drawings or payments, (ii)&nbsp;as a
partner or joint venturer in any partnership or joint venture, (iii)&nbsp;to purchase any materials, supplies or other property from, or to obtain the services of, another Entity if the relevant
contract or other related document or obligation requires that payment for such materials, supplies or other property, or for such services, shall be made regardless of whether delivery of such
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",FOLIO=blank,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]KH2301A.;2',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:58' -->
materials, supplies or other property is ever made or tendered, or such services are ever performed or tendered, (iv)&nbsp;in respect to any Rate Contract that is not entered into in connection with
a bona fide hedging operation that provides offsetting benefits to such Entity, or (v)&nbsp;to purchase or sell Equity Securities or other securities of any Entity. The amount of any Contingent
Obligation shall (subject, in the case of Guaranty Obligations, to the last sentence of the definition of "Guaranty Obligation") be deemed equal to the maximum reasonably anticipated liability in
respect thereof; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that (A)&nbsp;in the case of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>item&nbsp;(b)(v) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of this definition, the
amount of the Contingent Obligation with respect to the purchase or sale of such Equity Securities or other securities shall be the net settlement amount to be paid in cash or securities, and
(B)&nbsp;in the case of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>item&nbsp;(b)(iv) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of this definition, the Contingent Obligation with respect to such Rate Contracts shall be marked to
market on a current basis.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contractual Obligation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Contractual Obligation" of any Entity shall mean, any indenture, note,
lease, loan agreement, security, deed of trust, mortgage, security agreement, guaranty, instrument, contract, agreement or other form of contractual obligation or undertaking to which such Entity is a
party or by which such Entity or any of its property is bound.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Debt/EBITDA Ratio.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Debt/EBITDA Ratio" shall mean, with respect to Tenant for any consecutive
four-quarter period, the ratio, determined on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP, of:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The total Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries on the last day of such period, excluding any Indebtedness under or with respect to currency exchange Rate
Contracts;</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>to</I></FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The EBITDA of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Default" shall mean an Event of Default or any event or circumstance not yet
constituting an Event of Default which, with the giving of any notice or the lapse of any period of time or both, would become an Event of Default.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default Amounts.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Default Amounts" shall mean all amounts paid by Tenant or otherwise realized
by Landlord as a result of the exercise of Landlord's remedies during the continuance of an Event of Default under the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Default Rate.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Default Rate" shall mean the per annum rate equal to the sum of two hundred
basis points </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(a) in the case of any payment of Base Rent on any Portion of the Lease Investment Balance after an Event of Default, the Landlord
Contribution Rate or the Rent Purchasers Contribution Rate applicable to such Portion immediately prior to such Event of Default, or (b)&nbsp;in the case of any other payment, the Base Rate.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution Formula.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Distribution Formula" shall have the meaning set forth in
Section&nbsp;16.4 of the Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;EBITDA.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"EBITDA" shall mean, with respect to Tenant for any period, the sum, determined on a
consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP, of the following:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The net income or net loss of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period before provision for income taxes;</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus</I></FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The sum (to the extent deducted in calculating net income or loss in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>clause&nbsp;(a) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>above) of (i)&nbsp;all
Interest Expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, (ii)&nbsp;all depreciation and amortization expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, and (iii)&nbsp;all non-cash
charges taken by Tenant and its Subsidiaries during such period for in-process research and development.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible Assignee.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Eligible Assignee" shall mean an Entity that is a commercial bank or
another financial institution which is a qualified institutional buyer as defined in Rule&nbsp;144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended;</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>provided</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> that (i)&nbsp;such Entity has a combined capital and surplus of at least $100,000,000 and (ii)&nbsp;such Entity is acting through a branch,
agency or office located in the United States.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employee Benefit Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Employee Benefit Plan" shall mean any employee benefit plan within the

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entity.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Entity" shall mean any person, corporation, partnership (general or limited), joint
venture, association, limited liability company, joint stock company, trust or other business entity or organization.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Equity Securities.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Equity Securities" of any Entity shall mean (a)&nbsp;all common stock,
preferred stock, participations, shares, partnership interests or other equity interests in and of such Entity (regardless of how designated and whether or not voting or non-voting) and (b)&nbsp;all
warrants, options and other rights to acquire or sell any of the foregoing.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ERISA Affiliate.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"ERISA Affiliate" shall mean any Entity which is treated as a single employer
with Tenant under Section&nbsp;414 of the IRC.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Estimate Future Value.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Estimated Future Value" shall have the meaning set forth in
Section&nbsp;1.9 of the Lease.</FONT></P>

the Lease.</FONT></P>

the Lease.</FONT></P>

Lease.</FONT></P>

"Base Rate."</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Statements.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Financial Statements" shall mean, with respect to any accounting period
for any Entity, statements of income, shareholders' equity and cash flows of such Entity for such period, and a balance sheet of such Entity as of the end of such period, setting forth in each case in
comparative form figures for the corresponding period in the preceding fiscal year if such period is less than a full fiscal year or, if such period is a full fiscal year, corresponding figures from
the preceding annual audit, all prepared in reasonable detail and in accordance with GAAP.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Fixed Charge Coverage Rate" shall mean, with respect to Tenant
for any consecutive four-quarter period, the ratio, determined on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP, of:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The sum of (i)&nbsp;the net income of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(ii) to the extent
deducted in calculating such net income, (A)&nbsp;all Interest Expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, (B)&nbsp;all income tax expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such
period, (C)&nbsp;all rental expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, (D)&nbsp;all non-cash charges taken by Tenant and its Subsidiaries during such period for in-process research
and development, and (E)&nbsp;all amortization charges for goodwill taken by Tenant and its Subsidiaries during such period;</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>to</I></FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;The sum of (i)&nbsp;all Interest Expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)&nbsp;all
rental expenses of Tenant and its Subsidiaries for such period, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)&nbsp;the current portion of all long-term Indebtedness of Tenant and its
Subsidiares appearing on the consolidated balance sheet of Tenant on the last day of such period, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>plus </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>without duplication, (iv)&nbsp;twenty percent
(20%) of all off-balance sheet Indebtedness of Tenant and its Subsidiaries on the last day of such period; provided, however, that any Indebtedness under or with respect to currency exchange Rate
Contracts shall be excluded for purposes of the calculation under this paragraph (b).</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Foreign Plan" shall mean any employee benefit plan maintained by Tenant or any
of its Subsidiaries which is mandated or governed by any Governmental Rule&nbsp;of any Governmental Authority other than the United States.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Funding.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Funding" shall mean the payment of the applicable Acquisition Price by any Rent
Purchaser on the Funding Date.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Funding Date.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Funding Date" shall mean the date upon which the entire Commitment Amount is
funded to Tenant by Landlord and each Rent Purchaser pursuant to the terms of the Lease, the Participation Agreement and the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;GAAP.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"GAAP" shall mean generally accepted accounting principles and practices as in effect in
the United States of America from time to time, consistently applied.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Action.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Governmental Action" shall mean all permits, authorizations,
registrations, consents, approvals, waivers, exceptions, variances, orders, judgments, written interpretations, decrees, licenses, exemptions, publications, filings, notices to and declarations of or
with, or required by, any Governmental Authority, or required by any applicable law, and shall include without limitation, all environmental and operating permits and licenses that are required for
the full use, occupancy, zoning and operation of the Parcels.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Authority.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Governmental Authority" shall mean any nation or government, any
state, county, city or other political subdivision thereof and any entity exercising executive, legislative, judicial, regulatory or administrative functions of or pertaining to government.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Charges.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Governmental Charges" shall mean, with respect to any Entity, all
levies, assessments, fees, claims or other charges imposed by any Governmental Authority upon such Entity or any of its property or otherwise payable by such Entity.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governmental Rule.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Governmental Rule" shall mean any law, rule, regulation, ordinance, order,
code interpretation, judgment, decree, directive, guidelines, policy or similar form of decision of any Governmental Authority which is made publicly available.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Granting Rent Purchaser.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Granting Rent Purchaser" shall have the meaning set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Section&nbsp;7.4(c) </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of the Rent Purchase Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ground Lease.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Ground Lease" shall mean any ground lease or other agreement pursuant to which
Land described in a Lease Supplement is leased to Landlord, as ground lessee, by a ground lessor.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Guaranteed Residual Value.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Guaranteed Residual Value" shall mean an amount which is indicated
on each Lease Supplement as of the Date of Lease.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Guaranty Obligation.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Guaranty Obligation" shall mean, with respect to any Entity, any direct
or indirect liability of that Entity with respect to any indebtedness, lease, dividend, letter of credit or other obligation (the "primary obligations") of another Entity (the "primary obligor"),
including any obligation of that Entity, whether or not contingent, (a)&nbsp;to purchase, repurchase or otherwise acquire such primary obligations or any property constituting direct or indirect
security therefor, or (b)&nbsp;to advance or provide funds (i)&nbsp;for the payment or discharge of any such primary obligation, or (ii) to maintain working capital or equity capital of the
primary obligor or otherwise to maintain the net worth or solvency or any balance sheet item, level of income or financial condition of the primary obligor, or (c)&nbsp;to purchase property,
securities or services primarily for the purpose of assuring the owner of any such primary obligation of the ability of the primary obligor to make payment of such primary obligation, or
(d)&nbsp;otherwise to assure or hold harmless the holder of any such primary obligation against loss in respect thereof. The amount of any Guaranty Obligation shall be deemed equal to the stated or
determinable amount of the primary obligation in respect of which such Guaranty Obligation is made or, if not stated or if indeterminable, the maximum reasonably anticipated liability in respect
thereof.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Improvements.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Improvements" shall mean any Building located on any Land described in a Lease
Supplement and all related improvements, fixtures and equipment now or hereafter installed in such Building or on the Land on which such Building is located.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Indebtedness.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;"Indebtedness" of any Entity shall mean, without duplication:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;All obligations of such Entity evidenced by notes, bonds, debentures or other similar instruments and all other obligations of such Entity for borrowed money
(including obligations to repurchase receivables and other assets sold with recourse);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;All obligations of such Entity for the deferred purchase price of property or services (including obligations under letters of credit and other credit facilities
which secure or finance such purchase price and obligations under "synthetic" leases);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;All obligations of such Entity under conditional sale or other title retention agreements with respect to property acquired by such Entity (to the extent of the
