</FONT></P>
</UL>
<!-- Generated by Merrill Corporation (www.merrillcorp.com) -->
<UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Any amendment, waiver or consent which affects the rights or obligations of Administrative Agent must be in writing and signed by Administrative Agent.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No failure or delay by Administrative Agent or any Lender in exercising any right under this Agreement or any other Credit Document shall operate as a waiver thereof or of any other
right hereunder or thereunder nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such right preclude any other further exercise thereof or of any other right hereunder or thereunder. Unless otherwise
specified in such waiver or consent, a waiver or consent given hereunder shall be effective only in the specific instance and for the specific purpose for which given.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.05.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Successors and Assigns.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Binding Effect.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement and the other Credit Documents shall be binding upon and inure to
the benefit of Borrower, Lenders, Administrative Agent, all future holders of the Notes and their respective successors and permitted assigns, except that Borrower may not assign or transfer any of
its rights or obligations under any Credit Document without the prior written consent of Administrative Agent and each Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Participations.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Lender may at any time sell to one or more banks or other financial
institutions ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Participants</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") participating interests in any Loan owing to such Lender, any Note held by such Lender, any Commitment of such Lender or
any other interest of such Lender under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents. In the event of any such sale by a Lender of participating interests, such Lender's obligations under this
Agreement shall remain unchanged, such Lender shall remain solely responsible for the performance thereof, such Lender shall remain the holder of its Notes for all purposes under this Agreement and
Borrower and Administrative Agent shall continue to deal solely and directly with such Lender in connection with such Lender's rights and obligations under this Agreement. Any agreement pursuant to
which any such sale is effected may require the selling Lender to obtain the consent of the Participant in order for such Lender to agree in writing to any amendment, waiver or consent of a type
specified in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.04(a)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.04(b)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph
8.04(c)&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>or </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.04(d)&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>to the extent applicable but may not otherwise require the selling Lender to
obtain the consent of such Participant to any other amendment, waiver or consent hereunder. Borrower also agrees that any Lender which has transferred any participating interest in its Commitments or
Loans shall, notwithstanding any such transfer, be entitled to the full benefits accorded such Lender under </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 2.13</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>,</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 2.14</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 2.15</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, as if such Lender had not made such transfer.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignments.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Lender may, at any time, sell and assign to any Lender or any Eligible Assignee
(individually, an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignee Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") all or a portion of its rights and obligations under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents (such a sale and
assignment to be referred to herein as an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") pursuant to an assignment agreement substantially in the form of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Exhibit
G </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignment Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), executed by each Assignee Lender and such assignor Lender (an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignor
Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and delivered to Administrative Agent for its acceptance and recording in the Register; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however, </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;Without the written consent of Administrative Agent and, if no Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower (which consent of Administrative Agent and Borrower
shall not be unreasonably withheld), no Lender may make any Assignment to any Assignee Lender which is not, immediately prior to such Assignment, a Lender hereunder or an Affiliate thereof; or</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;Without the written consent of Administrative Agent and, if no Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower (which consent of Administrative Agent and Borrower
shall not be unreasonably withheld), no Facility A Lender may make any Assignment of its Facility A Commitment and Facility A Loans to any Assignee Lender if, after giving effect to such
<!-- SEQ.=1,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=50,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LF2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:59' -->
Assignment, the Facility A Commitment (or, after the termination of the Facility A Commitments, the Facility A Loans) of such Lender or such Assignee Lender would be less than Five Million Dollars
($5,000,000), except that a Facility A Lender may make an Assignment which reduces its Facility A Commitment (or, after the termination of the Facility A Commitments, its Facility A Loans) to zero
without the written consent of Borrower and Administrative Agent; or</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii)&nbsp;Without the written consent of Administrative Agent and, if no Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower (which consent of Administrative Agent and
Borrower shall not be unreasonably withheld), no Facility B Lender may make any Assignment of its Facility B Commitment and Facility B Loans to any Assignee Lender if, after giving effect to such
Assignment, the Facility B Commitment (or, after the termination of the Facility B Commitments, the Facility B Loans) of such Lender or such Assignee Lender would be less than Five Million Dollars
($5,000,000), except that a Facility B Lender may make an Assignment which reduces its Facility B Commitment (or, after the termination of the Facility B Commitments, its Facility B Loans) to zero
without the written consent of Borrower and Administrative Agent; or</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;Without the written consent of Administrative Agent and, if no Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower (which consent of Administrative Agent and Borrower
shall not be unreasonably withheld), no Facility A Lender may make any Assignment of its Facility A Commitment and Facility A Loans which does not assign and delegate an equal pro rata interest in
such Lender's Facility A Commitment, Facility A Loans and all other rights, duties and obligations of such Facility Lender under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents relating to Facility A;
or</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(v)&nbsp;Without the written consent of Administrative Agent and, if no Default has occurred and is continuing, Borrower (which consent of Administrative Agent and Borrower
shall not be unreasonably withheld), no Facility B Lender may make any Assignment of its Facility B Commitment and Facility B Loans which does not assign and delegate an equal</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>pro rata </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>interest in such Lender's Facility B Commitment, Facility B Loans and all other rights, duties and obligations of such Facility Lender under
this Agreement and the other Credit Documents relating to Facility B.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Upon such execution, delivery, acceptance and recording of each Assignment Agreement, from and after the Assignment Effective Date determined pursuant to such Assignment Agreement, (A)&nbsp;each
Assignee Lender thereunder shall be a Lender hereunder with Commitments and Loans as set forth on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1 to such Assignment Agreement </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(under the
caption "Commitment or Loans After Assignment") and shall have the rights, duties and obligations of such a Lender under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents, and (B)&nbsp;the Assignor
Lender thereunder shall be a Lender with Commitment and Loans as set forth on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1 to such Assignment Agreement </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(under the caption "Commitments
or Loans After Assignment"), or, if the Commitment and Loans of the Assignor Lender has been reduced to 0% and $0, the Assignor Lender shall cease to be a Lender and to have any obligation to make any
Loan; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that any such Assignor Lender which ceases to be a Lender shall continue to be entitled to the benefits of any provision of
this Agreement which by its terms survives the termination of this Agreement. Each Assignment Agreement shall be deemed to amend </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule I </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>to the
extent, and only to the extent, necessary to reflect the addition of each Assignee Lender, the deletion of each Assignor Lender which reduces its Commitment and Loans to 0% and $0 and the resulting
adjustment of Proportionate Shares arising from the purchase by each Assignee Lender of all or a portion of the rights and obligations of an Assignor Lender under this Agreement
and the other Credit Documents. On or prior to the Assignment Effective Date determined pursuant to each Assignment Agreement, Borrower, at its own expense, shall execute and deliver to Administrative
Agent, in exchange for the surrendered Notes, if any, of the Assignor Lender thereunder, a new Note to the order of each Assignee Lender thereunder that requests such Note (with each new Revolving
Loan Note to be in amounts equal to the applicable Commitments assumed
<!-- SEQ.=2,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=51,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LF2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:59' -->
by such Assignee Lender and each new Term Loan Note to be in the original principal amount of the Facility B Term Loan then held by such Assignee Lender) and, if the Assignor Lender is continuing as a
Lender hereunder, new Revolving Loan Notes and a Term Loan Note to the order of the Assignor Lender if so requested by such Assignor Lender (with the new Revolving Loan Notes to be in amounts equal to
the applicable Commitments retained by it and the new Term Loan Note to be in the original principal amount of the Facility B Term Loan retained by it). Each such new Revolving Loan Note shall be
dated the Closing Date, each such new Term Loan Note shall be dated the Facility B Revolving Loan Maturity Date, and each such new Note shall otherwise be in the form of the Note replaced thereby. The
Notes surrendered by the Assignor Lender shall be returned by Administrative Agent to Borrower marked "replaced". Each Assignee Lender which was not previously a Lender hereunder and which is not
incorporated under the laws of the United States of America or a state thereof shall, within three (3)&nbsp;Business Days of becoming a Lender, deliver to Borrower and Administrative Agent two duly
completed copies of United States Internal Revenue Service Form 1001 or 4224 (or successor applicable form), as the case may be, certifying in each case that such Lender is entitled to receive
payments under this Agreement without deduction or withholding of any United States federal income taxes.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Grant of Option by Lender to SPC.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, any Lender (a
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Granting Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") may grant to a special purpose funding entity (such entity being an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>SPC</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") the option
to provide to Borrower all or part of any Loan that such Granting Lender would otherwise be obligated to make to Borrower pursuant to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 2.01 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>or</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>2.02</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that (i)&nbsp;nothing herein shall constitute a Commitment to make any Loan by any SPC
and (ii)&nbsp;if an SPC elects not to exercise such option or otherwise fails to provide all or any part of such Loan, such Granting Lender shall be obligated to make such Loan pursuant to the terms
hereof. The making of a Loan by an SPC hereunder shall utilize the Commitment of the respective Granting Lender to the same extent, and as if, such Loan were made by such Granting Lender, but shall
not release such Granting Lender from any other liability under the Credit Documents. Each party hereto agrees that no SPC shall be liable for any indemnity or similar payment obligation under this
Agreement (all liability for which shall remain with the respective Granting Lender). In furtherance of the foregoing, each party hereto hereby agrees, which agreement shall survive the termination of
this Agreement, that, prior to the date that is one year and one day after the payment in full of all outstanding senior Indebtedness of any SPC, it will not institute against, or join any other
Person in instituting against, such SPC any bankruptcy, reorganization, arrangement, insolvency or liquidation proceedings or similar proceedings under the laws of the United States of America or any
state thereof. In addition, notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 8.05</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, any SPC may (x) with notice, but without prior
written consent of Administrative Agent or Borrower and without paying any registration and processing fee, assign all or part of its interests in any Loans to its respective Granting Lender and (y)
subject to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 8.10</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, disclose any non-public information relating to its Loans to any rating agency, commercial paper dealer or provider of a
surety, guarantee or credit or liquidity enhancement to such SPC. In no event shall Borrower be obligated to pay to an SPC that has made a Loan any greater amount than Borrower would have been
obligated to pay under this Agreement if the respective Granting Lender had made such Loan. Borrower, Agents and each other Lender shall continue to deal solely and directly with, and send notices
solely to, the respective Granting Lender with respect to any Loan made by its SPC and such Granting Lender shall not transfer or grant to its SPC the right to approve any amendment,
waiver or consent hereunder. This </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.05(d)&nbsp;</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>may not be amended without the written consent of each Granting Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Register.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Administrative Agent shall maintain at its address referred to in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 8.01 </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>a copy of each Assignment Agreement delivered to it and a register (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Register</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") for
the recordation of the names and addresses of Lenders and the Commitments or Loans of each Lender from time to time. The entries in the Register shall be conclusive in the absence of manifest error,
and Borrower, Administrative Agent and Lenders may treat each Person whose name is recorded in the Register as
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=52,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LF2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:59' -->
the owner of the Loans recorded therein for all purposes of this Agreement. The Register shall be available for inspection by Borrower or any Lender at any reasonable time and from time to time upon
reasonable prior notice.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Registration.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon its receipt of an Assignment Agreement executed by an Assignor Lender and an
Assignee Lender (and, to the extent required by </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph&nbsp;8.05(c)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, by Borrower and Administrative Agent) together with payment to
Administrative Agent by Assignor Lender or Assignee Lender of a registration and processing fee of $3,000, Administrative Agent shall (i)&nbsp;promptly accept such Assignment Agreement and
(ii)&nbsp;on the Assignment Effective Date determined pursuant thereto record the information contained therein in the Register and give notice of such acceptance and recordation to Lenders and
Borrower. Administrative Agent may, from time to time at its election, prepare and deliver to Lenders and Borrower a revised </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Schedule&nbsp;I</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>reflecting the names, addresses and respective the Commitments
or Loans of all Lenders then parties hereto.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Confidentiality.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 8.10</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>,
Administrative Agent and Lenders may disclose the Credit Documents and any financial or other information relating to Borrower or any Subsidiary to each other or to any potential Participant or
Assignee Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Pledges to Federal Reserve Banks.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, any Lender
may at any time assign all or a portion of its rights under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents to a Federal Reserve Bank. No such assignment shall relieve the assigning Lender from its
obligations under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.06.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Setoff.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to any rights and remedies of Lenders provided by law, each Lender shall have
the right, with the prior consent of Administrative Agent but without prior notice to or consent of Borrower, any such notice and consent being expressly waived by Borrower to the extent permitted by
applicable law, upon the occurrence and during the continuance of an Event of Default, to set-off and apply against the Obligations any amount owing from such Lender to Borrower. The aforesaid right
of set-off may be exercised by such Lender against Borrower or against any trustee in bankruptcy, debtor in possession, assignee for the benefit of creditors, receiver or execution, judgment or
attachment creditor of Borrower or against anyone else claiming through or against Borrower or such trustee in bankruptcy, debtor in possession, assignee for the benefit of creditors, receiver, or
execution, judgment or attachment creditor, notwithstanding the fact that such right of set-off may not have been exercised by such Lender at any prior time. Each Lender agrees promptly to notify
Borrower after any such set-off and application made by such Lender, </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>that the failure to give such notice shall not affect the validity of such
set-off and application.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.07. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;No Third Party Rights.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing expressed in or to be implied from this Agreement is intended to
give, or shall be construed to give, any Person, other than the parties hereto and their permitted successors and assigns hereunder, any benefit or legal or equitable right, remedy or claim under or
by virtue of this Agreement or under or by virtue of any provision herein.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.08.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Partial Invalidity.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;If at any time any provision of this Agreement is or becomes illegal, invalid
or unenforceable in any respect under the law or any jurisdiction, neither the legality, validity or enforceability of the remaining provisions of this Agreement nor the legality, validity or
enforceability of such provision under the law of any other jurisdiction shall in any way be affected or impaired thereby.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.09.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Jury Trial.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;EACH OF BORROWER, LENDERS AND ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED
BY APPLICABLE LAW, HEREBY IRREVOCABLY WAIVES ALL RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY AS TO ANY ISSUE RELATING HERETO IN ANY ACTION, PROCEEDING, OR COUNTERCLAIM ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO ANY CREDIT DOCUMENT.
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=53,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LF2301A.;4',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:59' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.10.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Confidentiality.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Neither any Lender nor Administrative Agent shall make use of, disseminate, or in any way disclose confidential information with respect to Borrower or any of its
Subsidiaries which is furnished pursuant to this Agreement or under the other Credit Documents except as authorized by this Agreement. As used in this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph
8.10</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, "confidential information" shall mean any and all technical and non-technical information including patent, trade secret, and proprietary information, techniques,
sketches, drawings, models, inventions, know-how, processes, apparatus, equipment, algorithms, software programs, software source documents, and formulae related to the current, future and proposed
products and services of Borrower and its Subsidiaries, and includes, without limitation, their respective information concerning research, experimental work, development, design details and
specifications, engineering, financial information, procurement requirements, purchasing, manufacturing, customer lists, business forecasts, sales and merchandising, and marketing plans and
information. Neither Borrower nor any of its Subsidiaries licenses any intellectual property to any Lender or Administrative Agent under this Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Each Lender and Administrative Agent is authorized to disclose confidential information with respect to Borrower or any of their Subsidiaries: (i)&nbsp;to its own
directors, officers, employees, auditors, counsel and other advisors and to its Affiliates who need to know such information; (ii)&nbsp;to any other Lender or Administrative Agent;
(iii)&nbsp;which is in the public domain at or subsequent to the time it was received by such Lender or Administrative Agent through no fault of such recipient, was rightfully in the possession of
such Lender or Administrative Agent free of any obligation of confidence at or subsequent to the time it was communicated to such recipient by Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries, or was developed by
employees or agents of such Lender or Administrative Agent independently of and without reference to any information communicated to such recipient by Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries;
(iv)&nbsp;if required or appropriate in any report, statement or testimony submitted to any Governmental Authority having or claiming to have jurisdiction over such Lender or Administrative Agent;
(v)&nbsp;if required in response to any valid order by a court or Governmental Authority; (vi)&nbsp;as necessary to establish the rights of any party under this Agreement or the other Credit
Documents; (vii)&nbsp;to comply with any Requirement of Law applicable to such Lender or Administrative Agent; (viii)&nbsp;to any Assignee Lender or Participant or any prospective Assignee Lender
or Participant, provided that such Assignee Lender or Participant or prospective Assignee Lender or Participant agrees to be bound by this </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph
8.10</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>; or (ix)&nbsp;otherwise with the prior consent of Borrower; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided, however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that (A)&nbsp;any Lender or
Administrative Agent served with any court order demanding the disclosure of any such confidential information shall use reasonable efforts to notify Borrower promptly of such court order if not
prohibited by any Requirement of Law and, if requested by Borrower and not disadvantageous to such Lender or Administrative Agent, to cooperate with Borrower in obtaining a protective order
restricting such disclosure, and (B)&nbsp;any disclosure made in violation of this Agreement shall not affect
the obligations of Borrower and their Subsidiaries under this Agreement and the other Credit Documents. Each Lender and Administrative Agent&nbsp;(x) shall treat all confidential information with
respect to Borrower and its Subsidiaries which is furnished pursuant to this Agreement or under the other Credit Documents with the same degree of care as it accords its own confidential information
and (y) represents to Borrower that it exercises reasonable care with respect to its own confidential information and has policies in place regarding the handling of confidential information by its
employees.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.11.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Counterparts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement may be executed in any number of identical counterparts, any set of
which signed by all the parties hereto shall be deemed to constitute a complete, executed original for all purposes.</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
[The first signature page&nbsp;follows.]</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Borrower, Lenders and Administrative Agent have caused this Agreement to be executed as of the day and year first above written.</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>*</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For a consecutive four-quarter period.</FONT>
<BR>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXPLANATION</I></B></FONT></P>
</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Applicable Margin for each Loan and Portion and the Commitment Fee Percentage for each Facility will be set for each Pricing Period and will vary depending upon whether such
period is a Level&nbsp;1 Period, a Level&nbsp;2 Period, a Level&nbsp;3 Period, a Level&nbsp;4 Period or a Level&nbsp;5 Period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The first Pricing Period will commence on the date of the Credit Agreement and end on September&nbsp;30, 1999 and each Pricing Period thereafter will commence on the first day
immediately following the preceding Pricing Period and end on the last day of the month three months thereafter.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The first Pricing Period will be a Level 2 Period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Each Pricing Period thereafter will be a Level 1 Period, a Level 2 Period, a Level 3 Period, a Level 4 Period or a Level 5 Period depending upon Borrower's Debt/EBITDA Ratio for the
consecutive four-quarter period ending one quarter prior to the first day of such Pricing Period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Examples:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Borrower's Debt/EBITDA Ratio for the consecutive four-quarter period ending May&nbsp;28, 1999 is 0.80. The Pricing Period of October&nbsp;1, 1999&nbsp;- December&nbsp;31,
1999 will be a Level 3 period.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Borrower's Debt/EBITDA Ratio for the consecutive four-quarter period ending August&nbsp;27, 1999 is 0.60. The Pricing Period of January&nbsp;1, 2000&nbsp;- March&nbsp;31,
1999 will be a Level 2 period.</FONT>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=1,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=1.01-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LI2301A.;2',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;08:59' -->
</FONT>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;The representations and warranties set forth in Paragraph 4.01 and in the other Credit Documents are true and correct in all material respects as of such date
(except for such representations and warranties made as of a specified date, which shall be true as of such date); and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;No Default has occurred and is continuing as of such date;</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;All fees and expenses payable to Administrative Agent and Lenders on or prior to the Closing Date (including all fees payable to Administrative Agent pursuant to
the Administrative Agent's Fee Letter);</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)&nbsp;All fees and expenses of Administrative Agent's counsels through the Closing Date; and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;Such other evidence as Administrative Agent or any Lender may reasonably request to establish the accuracy and completeness of the representations and warranties
and the compliance with the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement and the other Credit Documents.</FONT></P>

<!-- SEQ.=2,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(b)-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
</FONT></P>
</DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>SCHEDULES&nbsp;5.02(e)</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXISTING INVESTMENTS</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See Adobe Investment Policy (attached)</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<TD WIDTH="21%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;<BR></FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1><B>Adobe Systems Incorporated</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;<BR>
&nbsp;<BR>

Mountain View, CA 94039-7900<BR>
Phone 415 961.4400<BR>
Fax 415 961.3769<BR></FONT>
</TD>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds Managed By Weiss, Peck &amp; Greer

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government and its federal agencies may be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to Aaa rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or better. Long-term debt must be rated Baa and/or BBB or better by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's. Insured issues which are rated based on their insurance must be
rated Aaa by Moody's or AAA by Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-2,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Unrated Tax-Exempt Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Issues that are not rated may be purchased, if in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent
investment quality which meet one or more of the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Have been funded to maturity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Collateralized


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Backed by an Irrevocable Bank Letter of Credit which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by a Corporation which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Outstanding bonds are not rated; had a rating been applied for, the Advisor believes these securities would have received either an A long-term rating or
an A1/P1 short-term rating


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by an Investment Contract from a Bank, Corporation, or Insurance Company which meets the requisite quality standards.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrated securities will be limited to 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis. Only funds that seek to maintain a net asset value of $1.00 and maintain investment parameters that are at least as restrictive as those of the manager's will be
permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction-rate preferred stocks shall be limited to 15% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated AAA by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50%
of the Portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insured municipal securities rated AAA based on their insurance are limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested in securities rated Baa and/or BBB by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio. Municipal securities that may have been
funded to maturity in U.S. Government or its agencies' securities may be up to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 3 years.
<!-- SEQ.=5,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For securities that have put dates, reset dates, auction dates, or trade based on their average maturity, the put date, auction date, reset date, or average maturity will be used
instead of the final maturity date for duration and maturity guideline purposes.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The average duration of the portfolio will range from 1.0 to 2.0 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at each month's end. A complete and detailed listing of all securities held
for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The performance benchmark for this portfolio will be calculated as the average of the Bankers Trust Tax-Exempt Tender note and Lehman Bros. 3-year Tax-Exempt
Bond Index. This benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key objective. A
negative return of 2% or more on a 12-month rolling basis will trigger immediate review of the manager and the investment strategy.

</FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE LIQUIDITY ACCOUNT<BR>
WPG 9041

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds managed By Weiss, Peck &amp; Greer

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government and its federal agencies may be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to Aaa rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or better. Long-term debt
<!-- SEQ.=7,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-5,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
must be rated Baa and/or BBB or better by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's. Insured issues which are rated based on their insurance must be rated Aaa by Moody's or AAA by Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Unrated Tax-Exempt Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Issues that are not rated may be purchased, if in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent
investment quality which meet one or more of the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Have been funded to maturity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Collateralized


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Backed by an Irrevocable Bank Letter of Credit which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by a Corporation which meets the requisite quality standards


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Outstanding bonds are not rated; had a rating been applied for, the Advisor believes these securities would have received either an A long-term rating or
an A1/P1 short-term rating


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Guaranteed by an Investment Contract from a Bank, Corporation, or Insurance Company which meets the requisite quality standards.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unrated securities will be limited to 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis. Only funds that seek to maintain a net asset value of $1.00 and maintain investment parameters that are at least as restrictive as those of the manager's will be
permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction-rate preferred stocks shall be limited to 15% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated AAA by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50%
of the Portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insured municipal securities rated AAA based on their insurance are limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested in securities rated Baa and/or BBB by Moody's or Standard &amp; Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio. Municipal securities that may have been
funded to maturity in U.S. Government or its agencies' securities may be up to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.
<!-- SEQ.=8,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-6,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum maturity of any issue in the portfolio may not exceed 1.5 years.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For securities that have put dates, reset dates, auction dates, or trade based on their average maturity, the put date, auction date, reset date, or average maturity will be used
instead of the final maturity date for duration and maturity guideline purposes.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum duration of the portfolio may not exceed 6 months.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at each month's end. A complete and detailed listing of all securities held
for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benchmark for the portfolio will be the Merrill Lynch 3-Month Bill.

</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>INVESTMENT GUIDELINES FOR ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED

</I></B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>Funds Managed By Sterling Capital Management

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>

INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND PROCEDURES

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall manage the account of Adobe Systems Incorporated in accordance with the following objectives:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maintain </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>safety </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>of principal and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>liquidity </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>in order to
meet projected cash requirements of the portfolio.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
To maximize the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>after-tax total rates of return </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>on the portfolio while minimizing risk through a balance of
high quality, liquidity, and diversification in the fixed-income investment portfolio.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor shall achieve these objectives in the context of the following investment parameters:

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PERMISSIBLE INVESTMENTS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>U.S. Government and Agencies</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations of the U.S. Government, its federal agencies may also be purchased.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Repurchase agreements will be transacted with banks and primary broker/ dealers. Collateral must be delivered
versus payment. No safekeeping agreements will be entered into, and no repurchase agreements will be executed with non-primary broker/dealers or savings and loans.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Financial Institutions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Obligations issued by financial institutions with Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's short-term rating of A-1 or P-1
or long-term rating of A or deposit rating of A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Corporate Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All commercial paper, medium term notes, and public debt securities will be rated Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's
short-term rating of A-1 or P-1, or long-term rating of A or better, by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Asset-Backed Securities (ABS)</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Securities, rated AAA, supported by assets, such as automobile loans, owned by the issuer and, usually,
placed with a trustee. Must have a WAL (Weighted Average Life) not exceeding the longest allowable security under the Investment Policy. Limited to AAA rating by Moody's and a AAA rating by Standard &amp;
Poor's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Taxable and Tax-Exempt Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - All tax-exempt issues must have short-term debt ratings of MIG1/VMIG1 or P1 by Moody's
or SP-1 or A-1 by Standard &amp; Poor's. Long-term debt must be rated A or better.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All general obligations of governmental entities bearing a long-term rating of A or better or have a short-term rating of SP-1 or VMIG1 or better by Standard &amp; Poor's Corporation or
Moody's Investors


Service, Inc.
<!-- SEQ.=10,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-8,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All revenue obligations issued in conjunction with governmental entities described above bearing a long-term rating of A or short-term rating of SP-1 or VMIG1 by Standard &amp; Poor's or
Moody's.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pre-refunded municipal issues are permissible if, in the opinion of the Advisor, they are of equivalent investment quality and have been funded to maturity or are collateralized.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities subject to the Alternative Minimum Tax Calculation are permissible.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction-Rate Preferred Stocks</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - Industrial auction-rate preferreds must be rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's. In
addition, these securities must be evaluated and approved by the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Funds or Sweep Account</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> - As a portion of the liquidity of Adobe System's account, the Advisor may invest in money market
funds on a short-term basis.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DIVERSIFICATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Portfolio diversification of the portfolio will be a tool for minimizing risk while maintaining liquidity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No more than 10% of the portfolio will be invested with any one issuer, with the exception of the U.S. Government and its agencies for which no limit will be imposed.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For corporate credits, the maximum permissible concentration in an industry is 25% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Auction rate preferred stocks rated A or better by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's shall be limited to 25% of the portfolio. Corporate obligations for an issuer rated A or better
by either Standard &amp; Poor's or Moody's, shall be limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities can be up to 100% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Asset-backed securities shall be limited to 10% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Municipal securities escrowed in or collateralized with U.S. Government and its agencies' securities will be limited to 50% of the portfolio.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>PORTFOLIO CONCENTRATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Advisor will annually discuss tax implications for certain investments issued by certain states that may provide incremental after-tax benefits to Adobe
Systems.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>MATURITY RESTRICTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 2 years. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 2 years will be
permissible if the rate adjustment occurs within 12 months and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 2 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>DURATION

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The average duration of the portfolio will range from .5 to 1.25 years.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>EXCEPTIONS TO THE POLICY

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No intended exceptions to this policy will occur without Adobe Systems' prior approval.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that any unintended exceptions to this policy do occur, it will be reported on a monthly basis. Actions to eliminate any unauthorized exception will be taken as soon as
the exception is discovered.
<!-- SEQ.=11,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-9,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>VALUATION AND REPORTING

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All assets held for Adobe Systems in this account will be priced to market value at Adobe System's fiscal month end. A complete and detailed listing of all
securities held for this account, a summary of performance, and a detailed transaction ledger will be provided to the client on a monthly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For accounting purposes, all investments shall be deemed to be in the "Available-for-sale" category, as defined under Statement of Financial Accounting Standards (SFAS)
No.&nbsp;115, "Accounting for Certain Investments in Debt and Equity Securities."

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY REVIEW

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A review of the sufficiency of this policy will be conducted annually in conjunction with a review of account performance. Any modifications or amendments to
this policy must be in written form. Adobe Systems has the right to modify this policy at any time upon written notice to the Advisor.

</FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>BENCHMARK

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are
the key performance objective. The 1-Year Municipal Index will be the benchmark used for performance measurement of this portfolio. The portfolio will not be permitted to have negative returns on a
12-month rolling average basis.

</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=12,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-10,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADDENDUM TO INVESTMENT POLICY AGREEMENT

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Addendum is being made this 15th day of October, 1997 with respect to that certain Investment Policy Agreement dated December&nbsp;21, 1994 between
Adobe Systems, Inc. ("Client") and Sterling Capital Management Company ("Advisor").

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;This Addendum amends the Investment Policy Agreement, and in the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Addendum and the provisions
of the Investment Policy Agreement, the provisions of this Addendum shall supersede and control.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Maturity Restrictions", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 15 months. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 15 months will be permissible if the rate adjustment occurs
within 15 months and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 15 months.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The Maximum effective maturity of any issue of the portfolio will be 5 years. Variable rate obligations with maturities in excess of 5 years will be permissible if the rate adjustment occurs within 5
years and/or there exists a put option/provision for the instrument that can be exercised within 5 years.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

No more than 30% of the securities in the Core Portfolio will have final maturities in excess of 3.5 years.

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Duration", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

This average duration of the portfolio will range from 3 to 6 months.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The average duration of the portfolio will range from 1.3 to 2.3 years.

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;In response to section "Benchmark", the following change should be included:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>Liquidity Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

The benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key performance objective. The
benchmark for performance measurement of this portfolio will consist of 38% 1-Year Bond Buyer General Obligation Municipal and 62% 7-Day Floating Rate Municipal Index. The portfolio will not be
permitted to have negative returns on a 12-month rolling average basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>

Core Portfolio

</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

the benchmark will be used as a relative measure of performance but not as the sole measure of performance quality. Optimal after-tax total rates of return are the key performance objective. The
2-Year Bond Buyer General Obligation Municipal Index will be the benchmark used for performance measurement of this portfolio. The portfolio will not be permitted to have negative returns on a
12-month rolling average basis.
<!-- SEQ.=13,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-11,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301A.;19',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The undersigned do hereby acknowledge and agree to the aforementioned addendum to the Investment Policy Agreement between Adobe Systems, Inc. and Sterling Capital Management Company.

</FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="46%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>
/s/ Alexander W. McAlister </FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=1>Alexander W. McAlister - </FONT><FONT SIZE=1><I>Senior Vice President</I></FONT></TD>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED POLICY/PROCEDURE STATEMENT

</B></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
