<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>POLICY DESCRIPTION: Investments

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>1.0&nbsp;PURPOSE

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Investment Policy is to establish a worldwide Policy and guidelines to direct the investment of temporarily idle or surplus cash of the Company. Surplus cash shall
be defined as funds exceeding the operational requirements of the Company and not immediately required for working capital, capital investments, debt repayment or other financial obligation. The basic
objectives of the Investment Policy are, in order of priority:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safety and preservation of invested funds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Liquidity of investments that is sufficient to meet the Company's cash flow requirements


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Attainment of a market rate of return on invested funds that is consistent with the stated objectives

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>2.0&nbsp;SCOPE

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Policy shall apply to Adobe Systems Incorporated and all majority owned entities. This Policy shall specifically apply to all funds managed in-house by Adobe. In separate
attached exhibits, additional guidelines and/or variations on this Policy are included for funds managed by outside investment managers as well as Adobe's foreign subsidiaries.</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>This policy provides for investments in U.S. dollar denominated instruments only.</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This policy applies to:

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;X&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>All Adobe Companies</B></FONT>

</P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;Domestic Adobe Companies (in the U.S. and Canada)

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;International Adobe Companies

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;/&nbsp;/&nbsp;&nbsp;Other (describe:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;)

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>3.0&nbsp;RESPONSIBILITY

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Board of Directors is responsible to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Direct the Corporate Investment Committee

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Corporate Investment Committee is responsible to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Establish and maintain the Corporate Investment Policy;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Periodically review the investment guidelines and policies, as required by changing conditions, but at least annually;
<!-- SEQ.=15,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-13,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Submit any recommended changes to that policy as needed to the Board of Directors for approval;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Committee shall consist of the President, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, Assistant Treasurer and Cash Manager.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Chief Financial Officer (CFO) has the responsibility for:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Executing the investment policy as well as designate those who can execute it;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Administrative and operating approval for establishing any and all bank accounts, safekeeping/custody accounts, and brokerage accounts;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Selection of or changes in investment managers;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Monitoring investment results of all investment managers engaged, as well as results of in-house investment activities;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Advance approval of all investment transactions outside the parameters of the current investment policy, and notification to the Board of Directors of such transactions, and


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Control systems and procedures that provide for an appropriate level if segregation of duties related to the conduct and accounting for investment activity.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Treasurer has the responsibility for:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investment of the excess cash in accordance with the guidelines specified in this policy;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Custody of securities as well as maintenance of bank/brokerage accounts required for investment trading, and the underlying accounting for such transactions;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Reporting the status of investments to the Corporate Investment Committee on a quarterly basis, and more frequently in the event of unusual and material events in the marketplace
that would effect the status of the portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Managing all in-house funds in accordance with this investment policy as well as directing funds to any Investment Advisor/Management firm which has been approved by the CFO.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For purposes of compliance, the investments managed by any Investment Advisor/Management firm shall not be combined with investments made by the Treasurer but shall be considered
separately.

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>4.0&nbsp;POLICIES

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Statement of Objectives

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The surplus cash of the Company will be invested in accordance with principles of sound investment management and this Investment Policy. Any exceptions to this policy will have to be
approved, in writing, by the Chief Financial Officer.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The basic objectives of the Investment Policy are, in order of priority:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safety and preservation of invested funds;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Liquidity of investments that is sufficient to meet the Company's cash flow requirements;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Attainment of a market rate of return on invested funds that is consistent with the stated objectives.
<!-- SEQ.=16,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-14,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Overall Risk Profile

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The above mentioned objectives and the methods that the Company will use to achieve them are described below: </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>It is noted, however, that these guidelines will
remain applicable until the Company's cash position and outlook change significantly, at which time, the guidelines should be reviewed and, if appropriate, revised.</I></FONT>

</P>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adobe will ensure the safety and preservation of its invested funds by limiting default risk, market risk and reinvestment risk.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will mitigate the effects of default risk (the failure by a debtor to pay interest or principal when due) by:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Pre-qualifying all financial institutions and security dealers with whom the Company will do business;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Diversify the investment portfolio to minimize the adverse effects of the failure of any one issuer or guarantor;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Monitor the portfolio and trends in the business climate on a timely basis to anticipate and respond appropriately to a significant reduction in credit rating of any investment
issuer, guarantor or depository.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Invest only the safest type of securities.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Market risk occurs because the value of any security can rise or fall. Reinvestment risk will occur when a security matures or is called and
yields have declined. The Company will balance the effects of market risk and reinvestment risk by structuring the investment portfolio so that security maturities approximate cash requirements,
thereby avoiding the need to sell securities in the open market prior to their maturity.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will structure its investment portfolio so that securities mature to meet anticipated cash requirements (static liquidity). In
addition, the portfolio will include only securities with active secondary or resale markets (dynamic liquidity), providing liquidity through sale of a security should that be necessary.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yield on the company's investment portfolio is of great importance, though of secondary importance when compared to the safety and liquidity
objectives described above. Investments are structured in accordance with safety and liquidity in anticipation of earning a market rate of return relative to the risk being assumed. It may
occasionally be necessary for the company to sell a security prior to maturity to meet anticipated cash needs. This Policy does not exclude selling securities for realizing profits, but this is not
the primary goal of function of this Policy.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As described above, the Company's investment portfolio will be comprised of securities that provide sufficient cashflow to meet anticipated cash
requirements. Because cash requirement forecasts are necessarily uncertain, the maturity of investments in the portfolio will tend to be shorter than the actual


cash requirements forecast. Maturities may also be affected by liquidity needs, changes in interest rate environment or other economic or business needs. The following maturity guidelines will apply
to individual investment transactions and to the portfolio as a whole:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The weighted-average maturity is the average length of time from the settlement date to the maturity of the investments in the portfolio weighted according to the face value of the
investments. The weighted-average of the portfolio will not exceed one year.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For purposes of determining the weighted-average maturity calculation, the calculated weighted-average life (WAL) will be used for any asset-backed securities in the portfolio. If
<!-- SEQ.=17,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-15,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
one or more Investment Managers are used, separate duration requirements will be established under their specific Investment Policies. In addition, a maturity by definition shall include puts,
announced calls, auctions or other structural features which allow the Company to redeem the investment(s) at a quantifiable price consistent with liquidity, safety, and preservation of capital.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Individual security maturities will not exceed two years.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may invest in obligations of foreign branches of U.S. banks (Eurodollars) and U.S. branches of foreign banks (Yankee dollars) as
well as U.S. denominated commercial paper of foreign institutions. These foreign investments involve additional risks not found in investments of U.S. institutions. These risks, commonly known as
Foreign Credit and Sovereign Risk, may include unfavorable political and economic developments such as interest limitations, withholding taxes or the seizure of foreign assets.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign Credit Risk is defined as the strength and security of the institution's national economy. Sovereign Risk is defined as the political
stability and security of the country in which the assets are domiciled. For instance, a Japanese Eurodollar CD is exposed to the Foreign Credit Risk of Japan and it is exposed to the Sovereign Risk
of being domiciled "offshore" in Grand Cayman. Foreign Credit Risk is minimized by selecting very highly rated and respected foreign institutions. Investments are limited to only those international
institutions whose ratings qualify as "Investment Grade." In addition, Foreign Credit Risk is also managed by assigning foreign country exposure limits. These limits are based on an assessment of the
country's overall political and economic stability and are as follows:

</FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Japan, Germany, United Kingdom, France, Canada, Switzerland, Netherlands 25%&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

All others 10%

</FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sovereign Risk will be minimized by limiting the domicile of Eurodollar deposits to generally accepted safe havens, such as London, The
Netherlands, Toronto, Montreal, Nassau and Grand Cayman.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company will maintain a diversified portfolio consistent with the following:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other than U.S. Treasury and Federal Agency Securities, investments in any one obligation shall not exceed $15,000,000;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other than U.S. Treasury and Federal Agency Securities, investments in the obligations of any one issuer or guarantor may not exceed 10% of the value of holdings of any fund
portfolio or $15,000,000, whichever is greater;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
For corporate obligations, investments in any one industry group shall not exceed 25% of the fund portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investments in entities of issuers of any one foreign country shall not exceed 25% of the fund portfolio;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Investments in the following security structures (unless backed by U.S. Treasury or Federal Agency Securities) shall be limited to 25% of the fund portfolio or $30,000,000,
whichever is greater: Money Market Funds, Repurchase Agreements;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
At least 25% of the portfolio will have a maturity of 90 days or less.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Temporarily idle or surplus funds, available funds, are funds not needed for immediate cash requirements. Funds not so needed are available for
investing in instruments of appropriate quality and maturity. Funds that are raised via debt are available for investment until such time as they are required for the purpose for which they were
borrowed. However, any borrowing of
<!-- SEQ.=18,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-16,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
funds for the sole purpose of leveraging the portfolio by investing those funds is strictly prohibited.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2.12.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company may not engage in any non-business related investment activity that would be considered speculative according to the principles of
conservative investment management, whether or not that activity is specifically prohibited elsewhere in this Policy.


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Safekeeping

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments will be held in a custodial account, a safekeeping account or a broker's segregated account. All of the U.S. institutions qualified to do business with the Company are
authorized to hold investments in safekeeping on behalf of the Company. All investments owned by the Company will be held in safekeeping by a dealer or financial institution so qualified. For Outside
Investment Managers, a safekeeping/custody account may be established with an eligible bank or trust company to accept delivery of all investments made by the Investment Manager. Corporate Treasury
will reconcile the safekeeping/ custody account statement to the investment report submitted by the Investment Manager on a monthly basis.


</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
External Investment Managers

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon approval of the Chief Financial Officer, the Company may utilize outside fund managers to manage investments under the following criteria:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must manage a minimum of $500 million for other institutional clients;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must have an average performance for the prior three years exceeding either the average Donoghue index for the period for the short duration funds or the Merrill Lynch
1-3 year Treasury Index for the medium duration funds;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must provide the Company with requisite reporting;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Manager must comply with the Performance Reporting Standards of AIMR;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The maximum amount of funds under one external investment manager shall not exceed $300 million;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The intent is to treat all investments as "Available-for-sale" as defined in SFAS 115, unless otherwise designated.

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Internal Investments

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All investments made shall be consistent with the investment criteria of this policy unless prior consent has been received from the CFO.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.5.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Safekeeping and custodial arrangements may be made with investment banks who qualify under the stated requirements of Approved Securities
Dealers.


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Subsidiaries and Regional Offices (for those subsidiaries without specific investment guidelines)

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments shall be limited to interest bearing deposits or similar investments of a branch bank where the subsidiary/entity has an existing
operating account that has been previously approved by the Chief Financial Officer. These instruments must be direct obligations of banks where the Company does business.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Investments shall have a maximum maturity of 90 days and may only be executed by persons who have signature authority on accounts at that bank.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.6.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Specific investments or custodian relationships or procedures that are not consistent with this Policy can be executed or implemented only if
approved by the CFO in advance, in writing.
<!-- SEQ.=19,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-17,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->


</FONT></P>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.7</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Controls

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reporting requirements. Each month confirmation statements of activity and position will be sent to the Finance department for all investments
managed internally and externally.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Someone who does not have investment authority will reconcile all confirmations to bank or custody account statements.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate Treasury will report individual and combined results to the Investment Committee on a quarterly basis.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate Treasury will prepare a Report of compliance at the end of each quarter for all investments. In addition, compliance will be monitored
on a daily or weekly basis as reports and confirmations are received.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appropriate performance benchmarks will be established for each segment of managed funds. Analysis of performance will be done on a quarterly
basis and include: credit quality of each issue,


credit quality of any financial institution that provides a credit enhancement for the underlying security, maturity/liquidity, diversification, total after tax return, reports of any capital
gains/losses.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The "Investment Report" will be prepared on a quarterly basis for distribution to the Investment Committee and will at a minimum contain the
following information:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Inventory of portfolio investments as of the date of the report;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Average portfolio maturity;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Rate of return on investments;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Rate of return on the particular portfolio as compared to an appropriate benchmark;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
SFAS No. 115 reports;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Any violations or exceptions to the Investment Policy, including the reasons for and amounts of the violations or exceptions;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Status of any investments that might require management attention (such as investments affected by a credit rating change, or similar circumstances that could have an affect on the
value and collectibility of the investment);


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Summary of all international investments, including rates of return, average maturity and after tax yields;


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Verification of securities held in safekeeping.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<BR>

<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On a quarterly basis the Investment Report will be summarized for distribution to the Board of Directors.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.7.8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Investment Policy will be reviewed annually, at a minimum, to ensure that it remains consistent with the overall objectives of the Company
and with current financial trends. The Policy may be reviewed and updated more frequently if conditions dictate. Proposed amendments to the Policy should be prepared by the Treasurer and reviewed and
ratified by the Corporate investment Committee, the CFO and the Board of Directors.
<!-- SEQ.=20,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-18,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></P>

</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>5.0&nbsp;PROCEDURE

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>6.0&nbsp;EXCEPTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>6.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
This Policy provides guidelines for the management of the investment portfolio. Under some circumstances, investment transactions that are appropriate for the Company and entirely
within the spirit of this Investment Policy as described may not fall within the prescribed quantitative guidelines contained in this Investment Policy. It may be determined that an investment
transaction is in the best interest of the Company and is consistent with the objectives of this Investment Policy, in that case, the transaction may be permitted even though it is not consistent with
the quantitative guidelines, subject to the following controls:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Whenever a transaction that is an exception to the quantitative guidelines is made, it will be approved in writing by the Chief Financial Officer prior to being executed and will be
reported to the Investment Committee at the next scheduled meeting.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
It is the responsibility of the Treasurer to immediately report to the Investment Committee any credit downgrade, default, bankruptcy or event which may affect the investment's
value. The Investment Committee shall analyze viable elections with respect to the investment in question. Securities of investments that no longer meet the criteria of this Policy should be sold or
exchanged when market conditions permit realization of reasonable value. The Investment Committee shall decide an appropriate strategy regarding such an investment. Any investments or portfolios of
investments, which are assumed as the result of an acquisition or merger, will be evaluated for compliance with this Policy. If necessary, a plan for returning the portfolio to compliance under
guidelines will be established. A workout period will be established for this return to compliance.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>7.0&nbsp;DEFINITIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This section of the Investment Policy describes the securities and investments in which the Company is authorized to invest. Appendix A lists the limits and diversification
requirements for each investment.


</FONT></P>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.1</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>United States Government Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Marketable securities which are a direct obligation of the U.S. Government, issued by
or guaranteed as to the principal and interest by the U.S. Government and supported by the full faith and credit of the United States. Included but not limited to U.S. Treasury Bills, Notes and Bonds.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.2</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>United States Government Agency Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Debt securities issued by Government sponsored enterprises, Federal agencies
and certain international institutions which are not direct obligations of the United States, but involve Government sponsorship and are fully guaranteed by Government agencies or enterprises or have
implicit guarantees because of their relationship to the U.S. Government. Including but not limited to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal National Mortgage Association (FNMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Government National Mortgage Association (GNMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Farm Credit Bank (FFCB)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (FHLMC)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLB)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Student Loan Marketing Association (SLMA)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Agency for International Development (AID)
<!-- SEQ.=21,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-19,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<UL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.3</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Repurchase Agreements/Reverse Repurchase Agreements</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Collateralized loans by the Company to the seller (a bank, broker or
primary dealer in U.S. Government securities) secured by the securities transferred to the purchaser (the Company). They must always be fully collateralized by U.S. Treasury or U.S. agency
obligations. Collateral must be market priced greater than the invested amount at the time of purchase (usually 102%).


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.4</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Bank Money Instruments</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Obligations of commercial banks. Including but not limited to negotiable certificates of deposit
(domestic, Yankee and Euro CDs), Banker's Acceptances, Bank Time Deposits


</FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
(domestic or Euro). Deposits placed with offshore branches of approved banks (Euro CDs and TDs) will be limited to branches located in the British Commonwealth, including London, Toronto, Montreal,
Nassau, and Grand Cayman.


</FONT></P>
</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.5</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Short-term Corporate Instruments</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Commercial paper and other short-term, unsecured promissory notes issued by
corporations. Eligible investments must have at least a short-term rating of A-1 (Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's) or P-1 (Moody's) and/or a long-term debt rating of at least of A by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's
or Moody's. Medium-term notes and Master notes must have a long-term rating of at least A by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's or Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.6</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Municipal Obligations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Direct obligations of and obligations fully guaranteed by a state, territory, or a possession of
the United States, or any political subdivision of any of the foregoing, or of the District of Columbia as will as obligations of any county or other local governmental body within the U.S. Including
but not limited to:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Tax-exempt commercial paper


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Short Term Notes


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Bond Anticipation Notes (BANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Tax Anticipation Notes (TANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Revenue Anticipation Notes (RANs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
General Obligations (GOs)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Variable Rate Demand Notes (Low Floaters)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Revenue Bonds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Put Bonds


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Other Municipal Notes


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Weekly Floaters

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Approved credit enhancements include:


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Bank Letter of Credit (LOC) of a bank rated A-1/P-1


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Insurance by MBIA, FGIC, AMBAC


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Escrowed to maturity in U.S. Treasuries

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.7</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction Rate Securities</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Tax exempt bond funds which are leveraged and highly collateralized, whose shares are sold by
utilizing a Dutch Auction or other remarketing mechanisms, thus allowing the security to trade at its par value at each reset date. They must be rated at least AAA by S&amp;P or Aaa by Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.8</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Preferred Stock</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Preferred stock with a variable dividend rate which is determined through a Dutch Auction
mechanism allowing the security to trade at par on the auction dates. These
<!-- SEQ.=22,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-20,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->


</FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>
securities are eligible for the intercorporate Dividend-Received Deduction (70% tax-exempt for federal income tax purposes) as long as the security is held a minimum of 46 days and is not
debt-financed.


</FONT></P>
</DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.9</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Auction Variable Rate Bonds and Notes</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Floating rate municipal bonds or notes on which interest is exempt from federal
income tax and are sold using a Dutch Auction rate reset mechanism. They must be rated AAA by S&amp;P or Aaa by Moody's.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>7.10</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><I>Money Market Mutual Funds</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;Shares of an open-end investment company registered under the Investment Company Act of 1940
as amended. The investments of that company should comply with the SEC regulations under Rule&nbsp;2a-7 including:


<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Maintain constant net asset value


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Provide daily liquidity


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Average weighted maturity not to exceed 90 days


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Individual instrument maturity not to exceed 13 months


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
95% of the portfolio must possess the highest possible rating (or equivalent) and the remaining 5% will possess the second highest rating.

</FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

</B></FONT></P>

</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=9><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="22%"><FONT SIZE=1>Money Market Funds</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1>25% of portfolio or $30mm whichever is greater</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="25%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1>Follow SEC 2a-7 guidelines</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="17%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1>Assets of at least $100mm, redemption on request</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" ALIGN=CENTER><FONT SIZE=1>N/A</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
<TD WIDTH="100%" COLSPAN=9><HR NOSHADE></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=24,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=5.02(e)-22,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LJ2301B.;22',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->

</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX B

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPROVED BANKING INSTITUTIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Banks authorized to conduct general investment business with the Company must meet the following credit requirements:&nbsp;*

</FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>U.S. BANKS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is one of the 50 largest U.S. Banks (by total capital as ranked by Institutional Investor)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Thomson BankWatch rating no lower than "B"


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is a member of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporations


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The commercial bank's long-term rating must be at least "A" by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor's or by Moody's Investors Service, or a comparable rating agency

</FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>INTERNATIONAL BANKS

</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
The Bank is one of the 100 largest banks in the world (by total capital, as ranked by Institutional Investor)


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Thompson BankWatch rating no lower than "B"


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Limited to banks with over $20 billion in assets

</FONT></DD></DL>

<BR>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>*</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Banks which do not meet these criteria may be used in some circumstances, such as in a case where banking services from a qualified bank are not available. However, approval must be
obtained in writing from the Chief Financial Officer and documentation must be received as to why a qualified bank was not used.

</FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>Bank Credit Analysis

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Investment Policy shall employ the bank credit rating services of Thomson BankWatch as a benchmark for its bank credit analysis. BankWatch's ratings are based upon a qualitative
and quantitative analysis of all segments of the organization. The ratings are BankWatch's assessment of the likelihood of receiving payment of principal and interest on a timely basis. The ratings
incorporate BankWatch's opinion as to the vulnerability of the bank to adverse developments which may impact the market's perception of the company, thereby affecting the marketability of its
securities.

</FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPENDIX C

</B></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER">

<FONT SIZE=2><B>APPROVED SECURITIES DEALERS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>QUALIFICATIONS

</B></FONT></P>
<P>

<FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Securities brokers meeting the following qualifications may buy and sell investments on behalf of the Company, and may act as a safekeeping agent for Company's
securities.


</FONT></P>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Limited to U.S. Investment Houses, including banks, brokers, and dealers which have been in business a minimum of 5 years.


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Limited to Primary Government Securities Dealers or brokers and dealers which have been named to the Approved Broker List


<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>
Limited to banks which have a Thomson BankWatch rating no lower than "B"

</FONT><P><FONT SIZE=2>

<BR>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;FOR VALUE RECEIVED, ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, a Delaware corporation ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Borrower</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), hereby promises to pay to the order of
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;("</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the principal sum of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DOLLARS ($&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;) or such
lesser amount as shall
equal the aggregate outstanding principal balance of the Facility&nbsp;[A][B] Revolving Loans made by Lender to Borrower pursuant to the Credit
Agreement referred to below (as amended from time to time, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), on or before the [Facility
A][Facility B Revolving Loan] Maturity Date specified in the Credit Agreement; and to pay interest on said sum, or such lesser amount, at the rates and on the dates
provided in the Credit Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrower shall make all payments hereunder, for the account of Lender's Applicable Lending Office, to Administrative Agent as indicated in the Credit Agreement, in lawful money of the
United States and in same day or immediately available funds.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrower hereby authorizes Lender to record on the schedule(s) annexed to this note the date and amount of each Revolving Loan and of each payment or prepayment of principal made by
Borrower and agrees that all such notations shall constitute </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>prima facie </I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>evidence of the matters noted; </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>provided,
however</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, that the failure of Lender to make any such notation shall not affect Borrower's obligations hereunder.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This note is one of the Revolving Loan Notes referred to in the Credit Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, among Borrower, Lender and the other financial institutions from
time to time parties thereto (collectively, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lenders</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ABN AMRO Bank&nbsp;N.V., as agent for Lenders. This note is subject to the terms of the
Credit Agreement, including the rights of prepayment and the rights of acceleration of maturity set forth therein. Terms used herein have the meanings assigned to those terms in the Credit Agreement,
unless otherwise defined herein.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The transfer, sale or assignment of any rights under or interest in this note is subject to certain restrictions contained in the Credit Agreement, including Paragraph&nbsp;8.05
thereof.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrower shall pay all reasonable fees and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by Lender in the enforcement or attempt to enforce any of Borrower's obligations
hereunder not performed when due. Borrower hereby waives notice of presentment, demand, protest or notice of any other kind. This note shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
the State of California.

</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Borrower has executed this Revolving Loan Note on the date set forth above.</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;FOR VALUE RECEIVED, ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED, a Delaware corporation ("Borrower"), hereby promises to pay to the order of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, a&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the principal sum of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DOLLARS ($&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;), payable on the Facility B Term Loan Maturity
Date; and to pay interest
on the outstanding balance of said sum at the rates and on the dates provided in the Credit Agreement referred to below (as amended from time to time, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit
Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrower shall make all payments hereunder, for the account of Lender's Applicable Lending Office, to Administrative Agent as indicated in the Credit Agreement, in lawful money of the
United States and in same day or immediately available funds.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This note is one of the Term Loan Notes referred to in the Credit Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, among Borrower, Lender and the other financial institutions from time
to time parties thereto (collectively, the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lenders</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ABN AMRO Bank N.V., as agent for Lenders. This note is subject to the terms of the Credit
Agreement, including the rights of prepayment and the rights of acceleration of maturity set forth therein. Terms used herein have the meanings assigned to those terms in the Credit Agreement, unless
otherwise defined herein.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The transfer, sale or assignment of any rights under or interest in this note is subject to certain restrictions contained in the Credit Agreement, including Paragraph 8.05 thereof.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Borrower shall pay all reasonable fees and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred by Lender in the enforcement or attempt to enforce any of Borrower's obligations
hereunder not performed when due. Borrower hereby waives notice of presentment, demand, protest or notice of any other kind. This note shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of
the State of California.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Borrower has executed this Term Loan Note on the date set forth above.</FONT></P>

Title:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- SEQ.=1,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=F-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LU2301A.;14',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><B><I>EXHIBIT G<BR>
ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT, dated as of the date set forth at the top of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment&nbsp;1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto, by and
among:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;The bank designated under item A of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto as the Assignor Lender ("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignor
Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"); and</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)&nbsp;Each bank designated under item B of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto as an Assignee Lender (individually, an
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignee Lender</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>RECITALS</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignor Lender is one of Lenders which is a party to the Credit Agreement dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, by and among ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Borrower</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>,") Assignor Lender and the other financial institutions parties thereto (collectively, the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lenders</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ABN AMRO BANK N.V., as agent for Lenders (in such capacity, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Administrative Agent</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
(Such credit agreement, as amended, supplemented or otherwise modified in accordance with its terms from time to time to be referred to herein as the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Credit
Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignor Lender wishes to sell, and Assignee Lender wishes to purchase, all or a portion of Assignor Lender's rights under the Credit Agreement pursuant to</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.05(c)&nbsp;of the Credit Agreement.</I></FONT></P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>AGREEMENT</I></B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Now, therefore, the parties hereto hereby agree as follows:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise defined in this Assignment Agreement, all capitalized terms used
herein and defined in the Credit Agreement have the respective meanings given to those terms in the Credit Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Sale and Assignment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the terms and conditions of this Assignment Agreement, Assignor
Lender hereby agrees to sell, assign and delegate, without recourse except to the extent of its representations and warranties expressly set forth herein, to each Assignee Lender and each Assignee
Lender hereby agrees to purchase, accept and assume the rights, obligations and duties of a Lender under the Credit Agreement and the other Credit Documents having Commitments and Loans as set forth
under the caption "Commitments or Loans Transferred" opposite such Assignee Lender's name on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto and corresponding Proportionate Shares.
Such sale, assignment and delegation shall become effective on the date designated in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignment
Effective Date</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), which date shall be, unless Administrative Agent shall otherwise consent, at least five (5)&nbsp;Business Days after the date following the date
counterparts of this Assignment Agreement are delivered to Administrative Agent in accordance with </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph&nbsp;3</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereof.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment Effective Notice.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon (a)&nbsp;receipt by Administrative Agent of five
(5)&nbsp;counterparts of this Assignment Agreement (to each of which is attached a fully completed </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>), each of which has been executed by
Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender (and, to the extent required by </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.05(c)&nbsp;of the Credit Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, by Borrower and
Administrative Agent) and (b)&nbsp;payment to Administrative Agent of the registration and processing fee specified in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.05(f)&nbsp;of the Credit
Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> by Assignor Lender, Administrative Agent will transmit to Borrower, Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender an Assignment Effective Notice substantially in the form
of </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto, fully completed (an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Assignment Effective Notice</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
<!-- SEQ.=2,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=G-1,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LU2301B.;25',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;At or before 12:00 noon (local time of Assignor Lender) on the Assignment
Effective Date, each Assignee Lender shall pay to Assignor Lender, in immediately available or same day funds, an amount equal to the purchase price, as agreed between Assignor Lender and such
Assignee Lender (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Purchase Price</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), for the Commitments, Loans and Proportionate Shares purchased by such Assignee Lender hereunder. Effective upon
receipt by Assignor Lender of the Purchase Price payable by each Assignee Lender, the sale, assignment and delegation to such Assignee Lender of such Commitments, Loans and Proportionate Shares as
described in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Paragraph 2</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereof shall become effective.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments After the Assignment Effective Date.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender hereby agree
that Administrative Agent shall, and hereby authorize and direct Administrative Agent to, allocate amounts payable under the Credit Agreement and the other Credit Documents as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;All principal payments made after the Assignment Effective Date with respect to each Commitment, Loan and Proportionate Share assigned to an Assignee Lender
pursuant to this Assignment Agreement shall be payable to such Assignee Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;All interest, fees and other amounts accrued after the Assignment Effective Date with respect to each Commitment, Loan and Proportionate Share assigned to an
Assignee Lender pursuant to this Assignment Agreement shall be payable to such Assignee Lender.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender shall make any separate arrangements between themselves which they deem appropriate with respect to payments between them of amounts paid under the Credit
Documents on account of the Commitments, Loans and Proportionate Shares assigned to such Assignee Lender, and neither Administrative Agent nor Borrower shall have any responsibility to effect or carry
out such separate arrangements.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Delivery of Notes.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;On or prior to the Assignment Effective Date, Assignor Lender will deliver to
Administrative Agent the Notes, if any, payable to Assignor Lender. On or prior to the Assignment
Effective Date, Borrower will, if so requested by Assignee Lender(s) and Assignor Lenders, deliver to Administrative Agent new Notes for each Assignee Lender and Assignor Lender, in each case in
principal amounts reflecting, in accordance with the Credit Agreement, their respective Commitments and Loans (as adjusted pursuant to this Assignment Agreement). Each such new Note shall be dated as
provided in </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Subparagraph 8.05(c)&nbsp;of the Credit Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. Promptly after the Assignment Effective Date, Administrative Agent will send to each of
Assignor Lender and the Assignee Lenders its new Notes and will send to Borrower the superseded Notes payable to Assignor Lender, marked "Replaced."</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Delivery of Copies of Credit Documents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Concurrently with the execution and delivery hereof,
Assignor Lender will provide to each Assignee Lender (if it is not already a Lender party to the Credit Agreement) conformed copies of all documents delivered to Assignor Lender on or prior to the
Closing Date in satisfaction of the conditions precedent set forth in the Credit Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Further Assurances.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Each of the parties to this Assignment Agreement agrees that at any time and
from time to time upon the written request of any other party, it will execute and deliver such further documents and do such further acts and things as such other party may reasonably request in
order to effect the purposes of this Assignment Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Further Representations, Warranties and Covenants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender further
represent and warrant to and covenant with each other, Administrative Agent and Lenders as follows:</FONT></P>
<UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;Other than the representation and warranty that it is the legal and beneficial owner of the interest being assigned hereby free and clear of any adverse claim,
Assignor Lender makes no representation or warranty and assumes no responsibility with respect to any statements, warranties or representations made in or in connection with the Credit Agreement or
the other Credit Documents
<!-- SEQ.=3,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=G-2,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LU2301B.;25',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
or the execution, legality, validity, enforceability, genuineness, sufficiency or value of the Credit Agreement or the other Credit Documents furnished or the collateral or any security interest
therein.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;Assignor Lender makes no representation or warranty and assumes no responsibility with respect to the financial condition of Borrower or any of its obligations
under the Credit Agreement or any other Credit Documents.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;Each Assignee Lender confirms that it has received a copy of the Credit Agreement and such other documents and information as it has deemed appropriate to make its
own credit analysis and decision to enter into this Assignment Agreement.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;Each Assignee Lender will, independently and without reliance upon Administrative Agent, Assignor Lender or any other Lender and based upon such documents and
information as it shall deem appropriate at the time, continue to make its own credit decisions in taking or not taking action under the Credit Agreement and the other Credit Documents.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;Each Assignee Lender appoints and authorizes Administrative Agent to take such action as Administrative Agent on its behalf and to exercise such powers under the
Credit Agreement and the other Credit Documents as Administrative Agent is authorized to exercise by the terms thereof, together with such powers as are reasonably incidental thereto, all in
accordance with </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Section VII of the Credit Agreement.</I></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Assignee Lender agrees that it will perform in accordance with their terms all of the obligations which by the terms of the Credit Agreement and the other
Credit Documents are required to be performed by it as a Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto sets forth administrative information with respect to each Assignee Lender.</FONT></P>
</UL>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Effect of this Assignment Agreement.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;On and after the Assignment Effective Date, (a)&nbsp;each
Assignee Lender shall be a Lender with Commitments and Loans equal to the Commitments and Loans set forth under the caption "Commitments or Loans After Assignment" opposite such Assignee Lender's name
on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto and corresponding Proportionate Shares and shall have the rights, duties and obligations of such a Lender under the Credit
Agreement and the other Credit Documents and (b)&nbsp;Assignor Lender shall be a Lender with Commitments and Loans equal to the Commitments and Loans set forth under the caption "Commitments or
Loans After Assignment" opposite Assignor Lender's name on </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto and corresponding Proportionate Shares and shall have the rights, duties
and obligations of such a Lender under the Credit Agreement and the other Credit Documents, or, if the Commitments and Loans of Assignor Lender have been reduced to $0, Assignor Lender shall cease to
be a Lender and shall have no further obligation to make any Loans.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;This Assignment Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with,
the laws of the State of California. Paragraph headings in this Assignment Agreement are for convenience of reference only and are not part of the substance hereof.
<!-- SEQ.=4,EFW="9924519",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="5",FOLIO=G-3,FILE='DISK040:[99PAL1.99PAL2301]LU2301B.;25',USER='BHUGHES',CD='15-OCT-1999;09:00' -->
</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Assignment Agreement to be executed by their respective duly authorized officers as of the date set forth in</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2><I>Attachment 1</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> hereto.</FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=2><B>ATTACHMENT 2<BR>
TO ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT<BR>
FORM OF<BR>
ASSIGNMENT EFFECTIVE NOTICE</B></FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reference is made to the Credit Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;11, 1999, among ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Borrower</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the financial institutions parties thereto (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Lenders</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") and ABN AMRO BANK N.V., as
agent for Lenders (in such capacity, "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Administrative Agent</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). Administrative Agent hereby acknowledges receipt of five executed counterparts of a
completed Assignment Agreement, a copy of which is attached hereto. [Note: Attach copy of Assignment Agreement.] Terms defined in such Assignment Agreement are used herein as
therein defined.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to such Assignment Agreement, you are advised that the Assignment Effective Date will be&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to such Assignment Agreement, Assignor Lender is required to deliver to Administrative Agent on or before the Assignment Effective Date the Note, if any,
payable to Assignor Lender.</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to such Assignment Agreement, Borrower is required to deliver to Administrative Agent on or before the Assignment Effective Date the following Notes, each
dated&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[Insert appropriate date]:</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[Describe each new Note, if any, for Assignor Lender and each Assignee Lender as to principal amount.]</FONT></P>
<P><FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to such Assignment Agreement, each Assignee Lender is required to pay its Purchase Price to Assignor Lender at or before 12:00 Noon on the Assignment
Effective Date in immediately available funds.</FONT></P>
